This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Fortinet.
title: Is Cloud Security a Zero-Sum Game?

abstract: Brands are increasingly investing in their customer-facing channels: mobile applications, web portals, call center agents and chatbots, and many other endpoints - all to enhance the overall customer experience. This is called Digital User Engagement. Customers don’t just want their channels to conduct transactions – they want to anticipate customer needs, and deliver more personalized messages and offers to their customers. This demo will demonstrate a turnkey AWS Solution, Predictive User Engagement, which combines predictions and recommendations (AI/ML) with real-time notifications and analytics, based on a user’s engagement. The Predictive User Engagement solution pairs Amazon Pinpoint, a flexible multi-channel messaging platform, and Amazon Concierge, a managed AI/ML service that provides predictions and recommendations, and enables companies to quickly and easily add personalization to their web and mobile applications.
title: Predictive User Engagement

abstract: DevOps has changed how we accelerate business innovation by bringing development and operations teams together to deliver at high velocity. Security is becoming a more pressing mandate for DevOps as businesses strive for their output to be secure by design. In parallel, the security organization must apply and manage security policy on all cloud workloads to meet security and compliance objectives. These agendas are prone to conflict within the business due to resource restraints and differing priorities. IBM Security can help with that. In this session, learn how IBM Security uses automation to apply security technology, policies, and ongoing services to new cloud workloads at cloud speed. See how this automation resolves conflicting agendas by enabling DevOps to deliver “secure by design” at cloud speed without becoming security experts and without compromising security or time to deploy and time to market. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, IBM.
title: Empowering DevOps for Secure by Design (see it live)

abstract: More than 1,600 customers around the globe rely on Sumo Logic's secure, cloud-native, machine data analytics service for insights to build, run, and secure their modern applications and cloud infrastructures. In this session, we explore how Sumo Logic uses machine learning and the collective data of the Sumo Logic user community to deliver performance benchmarks personalized to your individual use cases and workloads. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Sumo Logic.
title: Learn How Sumo Logic's Global Intel Drives Better DevSecOps

abstract: Security remains a top priority as organizations shift their analytics practices from IT-driven report factories to self-service, governed analytics platforms. In this session, we’ll review how Tableau can be leveraged to monitor for malicious or unauthorized activity in your AWS accounts and workloads. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Tableau.
title: Threat Detection with Tableau and Amazon GuardDuty

abstract: Successful machine learning models are built on high-quality training datasets. Labeling raw data to get accurate training datasets involves a lot of time and effort because sophisticated models can require thousands of labeled examples to learn from, before they can produce good results. Typically, the task of labeling is distributed across a large number of humans, adding significant overhead and cost. Join us as we demonstrate Amazon SamurAI, a new capability of Amazon SageMaker that provides an effective solution to reduce this cost and complexity by combining a machine learning technique called active learning with human labeling. Active learning reduces the time and manual effort required to do data labeling, by continuously training machine learning algorithms based on labels from humans. By iterating through ambiguous data points, SamurAI improves the ability to automatically label data resulting in high-quality training datasets.
title: Easy Labeling for Highly Accurate Machine Learning Training Datasets

abstract: Enhance your applications with rich, interactive visualizations created in QuickSight, without having to investigate charting libraries, adding specialized analytics knowhow, or setting up and managing BI servers. Dashboard embedding with QuickSight is secure, serverless, highly scalable, and cost effective with QuickSight’s unique pay-per-session pricing model. Come see how you can use QuickSight’s new embedding and API capabilities to enhance your customer experience!
title: Embedding Amazon QuickSight dashboards in your applications

abstract: According to IDC, 71% of enterprises plan to deploy workloads on public cloud. But by many estimates, fewer than 20% of those workloads have moved to the cloud. Accelerating the journey to cloud requires strategies to modernize cloud application operating environments that accommodate enterprise workloads, security, compliance, and resiliency. IBM has worked with thousands of enterprises to develop a proven methodology for modernizing cloud application operating environments. In this session, IBM Fellow Bala Rajaraman discusses the evolution of enterprise cloud architectures as businesses transition from a Cloud First approach to Cloud Only strategy. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, IBM.
title: Modernizing Enterprise Application Architectures and Methods

abstract: As more data migrates to the cloud and further increases the accessibility and consumption of data by data citizens, organizations are looking to improve their hybrid data lakes on-premises and in the cloud. Whether an organization is starting to build its data lake or has an established data lake, governance is instrumental in enhancing the quality of data. A data catalog can provide a unified view and make data more easily consumable. In this session, learn how Collibra assists AWS clients in applying governance and breaking down data silos, using the data catalog to increase their data lake's effectiveness. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Collibra.
title: Enhancing Your Hybrid Data Lake with Catalog and Governance

abstract: In this session, REAN Cloud presents its proven and agile methodology for successfully migrating and transforming legacy monolithic applications from on-premises monoliths to lean cloud-native building blocks for a more adaptable and low-code enterprise. Learn how REAN Cloud, an APN Premier Consulting Partner, has helped customers transform legacy, monolithic applications into API-driven, microservices and serverless components built onto a highly scalable and well managed data lake architecture. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, REAN Cloud.
title: Moving the Immovable: Legacy, Monolithic App Migrations

abstract: Join Jake Brereton, a five-year Jira veteran, as he discusses how and why Atlassian chose to fork the code base of its flagship product and spend two years completely rearchitecting Jira from the ground up. Learn how moving from Atlassian's own data centers to AWS enabled the Jira team to ship more value to users in a fraction of the time, all while increasing uptime, speed, and reliability. From monolith to microservices, the project management tool Jira Software has been completely reimagined for the future of software development. And we're just getting started. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Atlassian.
title: The Hard Road Was Worth It: Making Jira Cloud-Native on AWS

abstract: Beyond the billions in dollars and petabytes in data, interactive marketing is still all about the basics – it’s about knowing your consumer. Infosys can help customers know consumers with its Genome Solution on AWS.  In this session, we discuss how this solution powered by smart algorithms provides predictive analytics and offers 360-degree view of the consumer to establish context and personalize offers for them. We explain how we helped a mortgage company achieve their business goals with the help of a new data analytics platform for customer-led generation and running personalized campaigns. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Infosys.
title: Driving Business Growth with Infosys Genome Solution

abstract: Organizations are leveraging advanced services of cloud providers to power their cloud adoption journey. Join this session to learn how Jim Maguire, leader of development and engineering at Dun & Bradstreet, engaged Wipro and AWS to build a next-generation platform in order to differentiate and address challenges faced by Dun & Bradstreet’s back office systems. This session is brought to you by AWS partner, Wipro.
title: Winning with the Cloud: Smarter Platforms to Transform Dun & Bradstreet Back-Office Systems

abstract: See how the microgrid allows you to purchase the energy you need at the best price, store it, and use it when you need it. Incorporate external data sources such as weather forecasts for a more complete view. The Microgrid uses AWS IoT Core, AWS IoT Analytics, AWS IoT Events and more.
title: Energy When and Where you Need it with a Microgrid

abstract: Are you running Kubernetes on AWS? In this session, we show you how to use the Elastic Stack—Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash—to gain visibility into all your Kubernetes logs and metrics in a single place. With the Elasticsearch Service from Elastic, you can spin up a cluster in a few clicks and go from data to insights in minutes. Also, through a live demo, we highlight how you can apply Elasticsearch machine learning and alerting features to your Kubernetes data to automate anomaly detection and speed up troubleshooting. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Elasticsearch Inc.
title: Logging and Monitoring Kubernetes Using Elasticsearch

abstract: Customer communications have traditionally been defined by long wait times, tinny music, and “do-not-reply” email addresses. A new guard of tech companies, such as Airbnb and Netflix, are redefining customer engagement. They build experiences that delight rather than aggravate, turning casual customers into brand loyalists. That customer experience is based on the trust they establish through their ability to scale a reliable communications flow. How do they do it? Join us, and learn how they leverage Twilio communications APIs that run on a massive scale with AWS. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Twilio.
title: Transform Customer Engagement with Communications APIs

abstract: In this talk, we’ll discuss how we transformed the development lifecycle of SAP HANA away from a traditional on-premises model to a cloud-first model. Built and designed natively on AWS, the next generation SAP HANA as a Service offering addresses the needs of SAP teams delivering new applications, services, and microservices to our ~450K customer base, as well as providing an innovation platform for partners and customers to develop data-driven applications. We’ll discuss our architecture and future goals, and we'll describe how SAP and AWS work together to make these goals a reality. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, SAP.
title: SAP HANA as a Service & AWS: Embracing a Cloud-Native and Cloud-First Mindset

abstract: Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics is the easiest way to process streaming data in real time. In this talk, we discuss the recently announced Java application support in Kinesis Data Analytics. You can now use Kinesis Data Analytics to build sophisticated streaming applications. Kinesis Data Analytics includes open source libraries based on Apache Flink, a framework and engine for processing data streams. The service includes over 25 pre-built stream operators like transform and aggregate, and can integrate with other AWS services with as little as a single line of code. The service elastically scales without servers and there is no complex infrastructure to manage. In this session, we start with an overview of the service, its capabilities, and the top use cases. Our customer John Deere then dives deep into their specific Amazon Kinesis use cases and discuss best practices for processing streaming data in real-time.
title: Introducing ML Insights with Amazon QuickSight - Demo

abstract: Increase application performance of your IO intensive workloads by ‘sharding’ data across multiple FSx for Windows file systems. This allows applications to read and write data in parallel from 10’s, 100’s, or 1000’s of Amazon EC2 instances and achieve greater performance then what’s available from a single file system.  Scale out your compute and scale out or file storage to achieve AWSome performance.
title: Demo: Scale out file system performance using Amazon FSx for Windows File Server

abstract: Develop and test your applications more quickly with Amazon Aurora, a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible database built for the cloud. We'll show you how Aurora helps you scale your applications, prepare data for testing, and optimize your database queries.
title: Building Your Application with an Amazon Aurora Database

abstract: Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) enables local connectivity for Amazon FreeRTOS devices at a fraction of the power budget required by WiFi, with up to 90% savings. Amazon FreeRTOS support for BLE enables developers to securely connect to the AWS Cloud through Android and iOS devices and consume AWS IoT Core services, such as Over-The-Air (OTA) firmware updates. Come see Amazon FreeRTOS in action.
title: See how to use Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to Connect Amazon FreeRTOS devices

abstract: Your robot can be programmed to perform tasks but it can also be "taught" to navigate or perform actions with high accuracy using reinforcement learning (RL). We demonstrate how we used AWS RoboMaker and Amazon SageMaker to teach a TurtleBot to follow an object in simulation. We dive deep into the architecture of this application and talk about different techniques like hyperparameter optimization and domain randomization that is used for building robust RL applications. We also demonstrate the scalability of the RL application where you could use several RoboMaker simulations to train an RL model in SageMaker.
title: How To Train Your Robot

abstract: Managing and optimizing costs is a top priority for organizations adopting a cloud strategy. This demo will showcase how you can use Tableau to plug directly into AWS spend data to increase visibility into cost and usage, allowing you to scale and optimize your cloud deployment. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Tableau.
title: Managing AWS Spend with Tableau

abstract: aibo (coming soon in US) is an autonomous pet robot series by Sony. aibo’s cloud is built on AWS and uses various services, like AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS IoT Core. We have joined the AWS RoboMaker beta for verifying how Sony can leverage RoboMaker as a part of our commercial products. In this session, we will introduce how we use AWS services for aibo, show various kinds of Serverless practices, and share our experiences with AWS RoboMaker.
title: How we made aibo smart: A journey through Serverless and IoT on AWS, and a view of AWS RoboMaker integration

abstract: How can you achieve full stack security—including infrastructure, network, host, platform, application, and data—in the Shared Responsibility Model? In this session, Armor discusses how to address the requirements of the Shared Responsibility Model while augmenting native AWS security controls, like AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), Amazon GuardDuty, AWS CloudTrail, Amazon Inspector, and AWS WAF. Armor also discusses how to unify visibility across your environment to effectively monitor your cloud security posture, as well as the role of incident response in security. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Armor Defense Inc.
title: Full Stack Security in the Shared Responsibility Model

abstract: With the hyperscale cloud gaining momentum, HCL has innovated and differentiated the way to harness the power of cloud. HCL's cloud adoption framework is based on the Maintain–Sustain–Explore strategy, and it provides a holistic approach for customers to accelerate their cloud journey. We assess their needs and understand areas where cloud can add value. We then design a roadmap to migrate workloads and applications to cloud. Lastly, we implement the migration roadmap and manage the customer environment using automation and cognitive abilities at the core. In this session, we explain how we help customers define, refine, and redefine their cloud adoption journey. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, HCL America, Inc.
title: Accelerating IT Modernization: HCLâs Cloud Adoption Strategy

abstract: Assets in the cloud can be vulnerable to cyberattacks. While cloud providers protect the cloud fabric and maintain the availability of cloud services, it is up to each customer to secure any and all data, workloads, and other assets that they place in the cloud. Check Point CloudGuard delivers unprecedented protection against even the most sophisticated fifth-generation cyberattacks that target cloud networks in a dynamic and elastic package specifically designed for AWS cloud environments. Join us to learn how organizations around the world are leveraging Check Point CloudGuard in AWS to achieve true DevSecOps at speed and scale. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Check Point Software Technologies.
title: Architecting DevSecOps: Advanced Cyber Security for AWS

abstract: IT operations and DevOps teams can use ServiceNow and AWS to create new applications and migrate legacy applications to the AWS Cloud in order to meet the needs of their internal and external customers. AWS and ServiceNow have developed a range of connectors to manage the migration process to the AWS Cloud, improve operations with AWS CloudTrail and Amazon CloudWatch, and provide improved governance of AWS CloudFormation through the AWS Service Catalog connector with ServiceNow. Join this session to learn about how AWS and ServiceNow can help you reduce costs and increase the uptime of your AWS Cloud environment. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, ServiceNow.
title: Optimize Cloud Migration and Ops with AWS and ServiceNow

abstract: The applications you’re developing today require flexible, dynamic network connectivity. Application usage, seasonal spikes, special events ... all these situations can drive periodic spikes in your bandwith requirements. In this session, join CenturyLink experts for a demonstration of Cloud Connect and Dynamic Connections, and learn how to add network capacity dynamically to respond to the needs of your applications. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, CenturyLink.
title: Dynamic Connection Network You Need the Moment You Need It

abstract: AWS is becoming a hotbed for blockchain innovation. To truly adopt the technology, companies must tackle such areas as security, scale, and integration with existing systems. Kaleido is a robust service that brings together the best of enterprise blockchain while using AWS with this single, easy-to-use platform. In this session, Kaleido, a blockchain leader, introduces a full-stack blockchain solution to simplify and speed the journey from blockchain exploration to production business networks. Come and see an end-to-end demonstration of the full stack with native connectivity into multiple AWS services. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Consensys Inc.
title: Whatâs New with Blockchain on AWS

abstract: Boosting innovation while effectively running your existing business can be derailed by excessive friction in processes, burdensome governance, and tools built to solve yesterday’s problems. In this session, you get key strategies for breaking through barriers to accelerate cloud adoption. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, BMC.
title: Cloud Adoption for Digital Transformation: A Path to Success

abstract: Learn how to quickly go from data to insights with Uptake and AWS. Uptake’s industrial AI and machine-learning expertise is codified and offered through comprehensive libraries of asset graphs, pre-trained models, and contextual datasets. These solutions are ready to use with services on AWS. In this session, learn how Uptake’s fully managed, industry-configured platform enables developers and data scientists to quickly and easily build, train, and deploy production-ready AI and machine learning models, as well as applications that drive the financial outcomes that matter to businesses. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Uptake.
title: Industrial AI: Accelerating Financial Outcomes with Data Science

abstract: AWS provides many security and connectivity options. However, pressures that stem from switching between on-premises and cloud environments remain. Developers and site reliability engineers are searching for security models that provide simplified API integrations in the cloud and adaptability to changing requirements without the need to revisit existing applications. In this session, we explore the limitations of traditional network connectivity solutions, which can be compounded by the move to the cloud. We explain how the Software-Defined Perimeter (SDP) model connects DevOps workloads without the need for manual intervention, simplifying security infrastructure. We close with an AWS customer case study. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Cyxtera.
title: Security at the Speed of DevOps

abstract: You’ve surely noticed a unique problem when taking your applications to the cloud: the need to find modern ways to observe your traffic. Today’s applications, especially those designed as microservices, are composed of a score of distributed services. We need to seek out new tools for observing and troubleshooting them. AWS provides a distributed tracing framework called AWS X-Ray that enables you to visualize how requests flow through your cloud infrastructure. In this talk, we demonstrate how your HAProxy Enterprise load balancer can send traces to X-Ray so you get a full and accurate picture of your distributed architecture. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, HAProxy Technologies.
title: AWS X-Ray Distributed Tracing with HAProxy Enterprise

abstract: In this demo, we will demonstrate how to build an Amazon Lex chatbot and integrate it with API services.
title: Quickly Build a Chatbot with Amazon Lex

abstract: In this demo, learn how AWS AppSync can help you develop data-driven mobile apps.
title: Building Serverless Applications with AWS AppSync

abstract: AWS billing data contains no breakout for container cost, yet operations teams need to keep track of container resource usage and utilization for proper cost allocation. Organizations take different approaches to allocate resource costs to containers, varying in terms of algorithms and level of precision. With nodes hosting multiple pods, pods sharing EBS volumes and services spanning different types of hosts, and reasoning about chargeback, showback and cost allocation very quickly become difficult. In this session, we discuss the benefits and challenges of various cost allocation algorithms for effective container cost allocation in AWS. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Cloudability.
title: Challenges of Container Cost Allocation and Chargeback

abstract: The combination of Sophos Outbound Gateway with Sophos UTM in AWS Marketplace provides a unique solution to secure the Internet traffic that is leaving your VPCs – including both EC2 instance traffic and Amazon WorkSpaces desktop traffic. The solution is designed to automatically scale for outbound web content filtering and support varying traffic loads, and works across peering connections. In this session, we demonstrate how Outbound Gateway and UTM can effectively provide reliable outbound traffic and web content filtering for your AWS workloads, enforcing corporate policy and restricting access to dangerous or undesirable websites. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Sophos, Inc.
title: Securing Traffic Leaving Your VPCs in the AWS Cloud

abstract: Static websites are faster than dynamic sites because they don't need server-side components. In this talk, learn to build simple static sites with backendless authentication using Okta, and understand how to continuously deploy and manage those static sites using Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) and Amazon CloudFront. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Okta, Inc.
title: Build and Deploy Fast Static Sites Using AWS and Okta

abstract: When you run on AWS, you benefit from a secure, scalable platform and a marketplace of thousands of security tools to protect your data. But what are the best practices for migrating sensitive data to the cloud? In this presentation, we guide you through the steps that payment SaaS platform Cardknox took to migrate their mission-critical, PCI-compliant applications to AWS with Logicworks, an AWS Premier Consulting Partner that specializes in secure, complaint AWS cloud services. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Logicworks.
title: How Cardknox Migrated 1M+ Sensitive Records to the AWS Cloud

abstract: It can take weeks to set deployment pipelines in the enterprise. At GitLab, we want to get developers started in minutes and build an experience where the only thing developers need to get live in production is commit their code. GitLab does the rest. Join this talk to learn how we automated CI/CD configuration based on learnings from over 2,000 contributors and over 100,000 organizations using GitLab. Learn how we integrated Kubernetes with our auto-configuration capabilities to make setup as simple as just a few clicks. We also demonstrate Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) and show you how quickly you can go from code to production. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner,GitLab.
title: Reinvent Your Pipeline with GitLab, Kubernetes, and Amazon EKS

abstract: More than 750 companies use Looker to save money, optimize queries, and improve utilization on AWS. With Looker's data platform and the Looker Blocks Suite for AWS, customers can surface critical information to optimize their Amazon Redshift cluster, break down cost and usage data, or investigate anomalies. Come get concrete tips on ways to get more from your AWS deployment, and hear how Looker’s data platform can enhance your cloud experience. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Looker Data Sciences.
title: Get More from Your AWS Cloud Using Data with Looker

abstract: The growth of DevOps has placed a spotlight on the security challenges in agile application development. DevOps groups are increasingly confronted with incorporating security solutions that bridge the gap left by rapid software development. Industry analysts estimate that over 80% of development teams will have incorporated security solutions into their DevOps environment by 2021. In this session, learn about security trends and how to deliver security for DevOps as we identify strategies for a proactive and preventative security approach, and examine the new security challenges posed by automated API-driven frameworks. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Imperva.
title: Security Challenges in a DevOps World

abstract: Software engineers have a responsibility to build systems capable of surviving unreliable and unpredictable environments. That’s why distributed, multi-regional systems are increasingly requested by enterprise and SMB customers alike. In this session, Beau Christensen, Senior Engineering Manager at Splunk, discusses how to move systems and applications into a globally distributed deployment posture, and eventually into a multi-master active-active state. We cover key strategies for identifying seams in your application, including use of chaos engineering to encourage responsible design choices and the selection of cloud infrastructure instead of self-built colocation. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, VictorOps.
title: Active-Active: Practical Strategies for Distributed Systems

abstract: Navigating the landscape of ever growing SAP HANA migration tools, programs, and paths can be daunting. With the SAP Database Migration Testing cloud service, a fast-track SAP database migration factory program, you can provision SAP HANA server instances on AWS, use proven tools to move applications, convert your data, and test the success of your migration—all without needing extra hardware or disrupting production systems. In this session, we highlight best practices and lessons learned during AWS migration for SAP landscapes. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, SAP.
title: Donât Be Left Behind - Join the Migration to SAP HANA

abstract: Diverse businesses, from dog walking apps to truck brokerage platforms, are investing in live tracking solutions. If you're trying to build one, what are the key technical considerations? What are the major components? Join Alex Yule and Amy Ghate from Mapbox as they talk about how they built a scalable solution using AWS services like Amazon Kinesis and AWS Lambda and Mapbox's location platform to track the location, ETAs, distance from destination, and other metadata of hundreds of assets in real time. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Mapbox, Inc.
title: Architecting Asset Tracking with AWS and Mapbox

abstract: Modern application delivery requires chaining together a series of technologies to ensure secure, high-performance digital apps. Companies must combine ingress and egress technologies, like CDNs, network load balancers, application load balancers, API gateways, web application firewalls, and reverse proxies. In this session, learn how NGINX leveraged AWS to create a much simpler architecture. The NGINX Application Platform connects with Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) to create an ingress and egress mesh. Customers get load balancing, proxying, WAF, and API gateways as a single, elastic pool of resources that automatically scales, improving the efficiency and scalability of AWS-based digital apps. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, NGINX.
title: Use Elastic Load Balancing and NGINX to Create Elastic Ingress & Egress Tier

abstract: Join us as we talk about IBM’s game-changing Kubernetes and management capabilities, led by our recently announced cloud management solution. This solution provides customers with consistent visibility into hybrid infrastructures, built-in governance, and consistent application management across across public, private, and hybrid cloud environments. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, IBM.
title: Cloud Management in a Hybrid Cloud World

abstract: The overall evolution towards microservices has caused a lot of IT leaders to radically rethink architectures and platforms. One can hardly keep up with the rapid onslaught on new distributed technologies. The same people who just asked yesterday, "How can we deploy Docker containers?" are now asking, "How can we operate Kubernetes-as-a-service on premises?" and are about to start asking, "How can we operate the open source frameworks of our choice, such as Spark, TensorFlow, HDFS, and more, as a service across hybrid clouds?” This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Mesosphere.
title: Run Everything-as-a-Service Everywhere

abstract: Capital One's Cloud Custodian is an open source stateless rules engine to help you more effectively manage your Amazon Web Services (AWS) accounts. With comprehensive support, it works with AWS Lambda, AWS Config, AWS Cloudtrail, Amazon CloudWatchEvents, and Amazon GuardDuty to provide real time guard rail automation. You can express complex policies and workflows via simple YAML DSL to allow for a compliance as code approach. Learn why it has been adopted by a community of thousands of organizations to help them achieve security, compliance, and cost savings and how you can too.This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Capital One.
title: Cloud Custodian - OpenSource AWS Security & Governance

abstract: Your customers live in the instant economy where expectations around latency for apps continue to skyrocket. In this economy, a brownout is the new blackout. In this session, learn some common best practices for using Redis on AWS to boost the performance of your apps. We discuss the top five things that you can do today with Redis to improve your application performance which don’t require a full re-architecture. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Redis Labs.
title: Best Practices for Exceeding Customer Expectations with Redis

abstract: In this session, learn how Fathead worked with Cloudinary to build a robust, end-to-end image management solution, allowing user content to be seamlessly printed—and bringing it to life. Hear Jessica Roland, product owner lead at Fathead, discuss how the company built a custom business around web-to-print orders, and learn how they provide on-the-fly images on their site. Discover what drove them to buy a solution instead of building it in-house. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Cloudinary.
title: Bringing Your Visual Content to Life

abstract: As our digitally connected ecosystem continues to evolve, adapt, and innovate, there has been a consistent, underlying theme across the landscape. Teams are struggling to balance their increasing workloads with limited resources at their disposal. As a result, it is becoming more difficult for security, IT, and DevOps teams to accomplish their goals, collaborate, and be successful. As an industry, it's time we invest in technologies and methodologies that enhance our tools, processes, and people. Come to this session to learn how. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Rapid7.
title: Orchestration & Automation: The Great Unifiers

abstract: There are many considerations when architecting to scale a Kubernetes or Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) effectively, especially in heterogeneous environments that are composed of different machine types and sizes. To increase the cluster’s efficiency, it is crucial to choose the right instance size and type for the right workload. In this session, we discuss the two important concepts of Kubernetes: Headroom and 2 Levels Scaling. In addition, we review the different Kubernetes deployment tools, including Kubernetes Operations (Kops). This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Spotinst Ltd.
title: Achieving a Serverless Experience While Scaling with Kubernetes or Amazon ECS

abstract: DevOps teams run a variety of applications on AWS to foster enhanced agility and rapid innovation. However, the complexity of adopting a large number of cloud services can lead to application deployment and monitoring challenges and suboptimal cloud expenditure. In this session, learn how the Nutanix Enterprise Cloud OS provides a single operating system that helps DevOps teams automate application lifecycle management, centralize governance, optimize cloud consumption, and monitor application health across AWS environments. As a result, DevOps teams running applications in AWS maintain high performance, rapid response time, and efficient resource utilization. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Nutanix.
title: Making Cloud Management Nearly Invisible

abstract: Selecting the optimal cloud resources for your applications can be challenging because you can configure your cloud instances in many different ways. Technical operations managers face this challenge every day, and they try to manually find the perfect match and avoid potential operational risks. Join the VP of technical advisors at Densify to learn how one line of code (e.g., Terraform) can precisely and automatically align the demands of your apps with the right AWS resources and improve app performance with reduced operational risks. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Densify.
title: Get Better App Performance with âOptimization as Codeâ

abstract: User expectations for great web and mobile experiences are higher than ever. Whether it's for longer sessions or more conversions, building and delivering an amazing app is a critical part of your users' happiness and the overall success of your app. In this talk, we review every level of the stack, and we share how you can deliver a digital experience that is engaging, fast, reliable, and secure. From the network to cloud infrastructure, from the backend to front-end application layers, learn what to optimize to have a positive impact on your users' happiness and your success. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Akamai Technologies.
title: Secrets to Building and Delivering Amazing Apps at Scale

abstract: Cloud adoption has quickened the pace of innovation and allowed organizations to deploy at larger scales, greater speeds, and lower costs. The most forward-thinking organizations have migrated many existing applications from on-premises to Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2), while taking advantage of advances in containerization and serverless computing for new applications. However, due to differing requirements and capabilities across on-premises, hybrid, and public cloud environments, the migration and ongoing management process can be difficult for unprepared organizations. In this talk, we explore how a flexible single control plane enables organizations to support, secure, and accelerate applications across all types of cloud environments. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, Cloudflare.
title: Migrating to the Cloud with Serverless: What Enterprises Need to Know

abstract: In this session, we share with you our research about lessons learned from a decade of data breaches. Find out how to leverage automated learning capabilities to prevent even the most sophisticated attacks on your data. Learn how you can safeguard your data, meet compliance regulations, and establish ongoing protection for your cloud workloads. Gain insights on key application and architecture considerations for picking the right WAF. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, F5 Networks.
title: Enhance Your Application Security Strategy

abstract: "aibo" is an autonomous pet robot series by Sony, coming soon to the US. "aibo" cloud built on AWS uses various services, especially serverless one such as AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS IoT Core. In this session, we introduce how we use AWS services on aibo, and we share some of our serverless practices.
title: How We Made "aibo" Smart: A Journey through Serverless & IoT on AWS

abstract: Exact Sciences (Exact), maker of Cologuard, a noninvasive colon cancer screening test, partnered with itelligence, an IT business consulting firm, to migrate to SAP S/4HANA on AWS while maintaining compliance controls with HIPAA security and privacy rules. itelligence and Exact have an existing relationship to maintain a legacy ERP system. Given Exact’s business growth over the past six years, the team decided to migrate directly to SAP S/4HANA on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications to leverage the power of the digital core. itelligence led a series of digital transformation workshops focused on the migration to S/4HANA. These workshops helped Exact understand what a migration would look like, how it would take place, and what the specific steps would be. The outcome was an investment decision designed under the umbrella of the new S/4HANA-enabled business processes to support Exact’s future growth plans. Together, they created a migration roadmap on AWS to take advantage of a scalable, flexible, cost-effective, reliable, and secure platform, while supporting the company’s HIPAA compliance requirements. This presentation is brought to you by AWS partner, SUSE.
title: Supporting an Early Cancer Detection Vision with SAP S/4HANA on AWS

abstract: Join us to learn how AWS enables developers to build enaging experiences across the web and mobile devices.
title: Building Engaging Mobile Apps

abstract: Join this demo-driven session to learn about a simple way to move data rapidly into Amazon S3. Then, see how to access it on-premises with AWS Storage Gateway for local applications. You’ll leave understanding how to improve data transfer performance without the manual labor of extensive scripting or the cost of third-party licensed software.
title: How to Move Data to Amazon S3 and Access It On-Premises

abstract: The days of the one-size-fits-all monolithic database are behind us, and developers are now building highly functional and performant applications using a multitude of purpose-built databases. In this demo, we’ll use an ecommerce application and match use cases with the best database for the job.
title: Databases on AWS: The Right Tool for the Right Job

abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss deploying securely at scale from source control to production using a DevSecOps model. Participants need to have prior basic knowledge of DevOps, automated deployments, and infrastructure as code (IaC). With your AWS Organization as a target, we demonstrate how to perform secured, continuous, automated, and multi-account deployments using services such as AWS Organizations, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CloudFormation. After this session, you gain a familiarity with DevSecOps best practices, how to ensure only compliant code gets deployed into production based on your AWS Organization, and how AWS services combined with open-source technology can help you achieve this.
title: Securely Deploying at Scale

abstract: AWS RoboMaker has released open source Robot Operating System nodes for community use. These nodes are called Cloud Service Extensions, allowing developers to utilize Amazon Web Services from a ROS API. A high-level architecture design on how to use these to create an “intelligent” robot is presented as well as an in-depth look into a few of the nodes. On the board, we journey from ROS best practices to discussing ROS task-based programming and optimization as a developer. At this point, the group understands how to use AWS and the RoboMaker Cloud Service Extensions for ROS to power their robots. The next release of ROS (ROS2) is around the corner, and developers looking forward to secure transport, DDS, and better API’s need to understand how to move forward. The internals of ROS and ROS2 are generalized to highlight the differences between the two systems, comparing ROS concepts and how to use them
title: ROS and AWS RoboMaker

abstract: Zuul, Netflix’s cloud gateway, is the front door for all requests coming into the Netflix cloud infrastructure. It handles more than one million requests per second. How do we efficiently operate Zuul with a minimal operational and support burden and a happy team of six? In this chalk talk, learn how we achieve this by taking a DevOps first approach and a desire to sleep at night.
title: Sleeping on the Edge: Running and Operating Netflix's Cloud Edge, Zuul

abstract: In this session, we show you how to set the source Oracle database environment, the target PostgreSQL environment, and parameter group configuration. We also recommended database parameters to disable foreign keys and triggers. Finally, we discuss best practices for using AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) and show you how to choose the instance type and configure AWS DMS.
title: Migrate from Oracle to Aurora PostgreSQL: Best Practices, Design Patterns, & Setup

abstract: In this session, learn how the Multi-Master capability of Amazon Aurora MySQL enables applications to scale out write performance and achieve continuous read/write availability. Engineering experts dive into the design concepts of Aurora Multi-Master, and provide real-world advice on deploying high-throughput, highly available workloads in Aurora.
title: Amazon Aurora Multi-Master: Scaling Out Database Write Performance

abstract: Monetizing live video streams can be a challenge. AWS Elemental MediaTailor can help make that challenge easier to overcome. For best returns, streaming video solutions should use server-side ad insertion, target different devices, personalize ads for each viewer, and be able to scale for the most popular events, like live sports. In this chalk talk, learn the important questions to ask when building a dynamic ad insertion solution for live video streaming, and how to successfully serve billions of ad impressions across a range of playback devices.
title: Monetizing Live OTT Streams Made Easier

abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender is a fully managed service that helps you secure your fleet of IoT devices. In this session, we dive into Device Defender Detect, the feature that monitors metrics collected on device and cloud-side to identify anomalous behaviors. We get into the details of how Device Defender Detect works and metrics that it supports. The session includes a demo of how best to leverage Device Defender Detect for keeping your devices secure.
title: Managing Security of Large IoT Fleets

abstract: AWS IoT Device Tester is a test automation application that enables you to self-test your devices for Amazon FreeRTOS and AWS IoT Greengrass. With AWS IoT Device Tester, you can easily perform qualification testing to determine if your devices can run Amazon FreeRTOS and/or AWS IoT Greengrass, and interoperate securely with AWS IoT services. Come learn how AWS IoT Device Tester simplifies testing of Amazon FreeRTOS and AWS IoT Greengrass devices.
title: AWS IoT Device Tester: Enable Your Edge Devices for AWS IoT

abstract: Large call volumes into customer service call centers can lead to frustrated customers, delayed responses, and overburdened staff, particularly when a large number of queries could have been resolved with simple yes or no answers, or formulaic responses. In this session hear from the National Health Service (NHS) Business Services Authority, the support body for multiple NHS organizations in England, how it is using machine learning to manage the large volumes of calls coming to their call center (five million calls each year). Learn how these services have been used to reduce call response times, increase staff morale, and maximize staff utilization for value-add activities. See how to develop and implement Amazon Connect, Amazon Lex, and Amazon Polly to automate call centers, reduce labor costs, and provide a consistent experience for customers.
title: Optimizing Healthcare Call Centers with Natural Language Understanding

abstract: Moving backups to the cloud and managing data protection across on-premises and cloud environments can be challenging. AWS Partner Network (APN) Advanced and Storage Competency Technology Partner, Rubrik, showcases its Cloud Data Management solution, and how it delivers backup, instant application availability, replication, DR, search, archival, and analytics, enabling you to lower your recovery time objective (RTO) to just minutes. In this chalk talk, Rubik shows how you can back up local data copies to Amazon S3, back up Amazon EC2 instances by deploying Rubrik software on AWS, and archive long-term data to Amazon Glacier.
title: Back Up and Manage On-Premises and Cloud-Native Workloads with Rubrik on AWS

abstract: Most communities are currently language specific. To engage in a community the user must speak the language native language. In this chalk talk, we will discuss how you can integrate state of the art machine translation to enable users to effectively share and consume content in their language of choice and create truly global communities. Broadening the user base through seamless language translation helps developers increase participation and contribution, ultimately improving the economics of their applications.
title: Building Online Communities Without Language Barriers

abstract: The broad adoption of serverless architectures across industries and segments not only impacts our customers’ cost models and speed to market, but it also changes what they need from our partner community. In this interactive chalk talk, we discuss the patterns we observe in our most successful consulting partners who are growing their client base and expanding their influence within existing accounts using serverless approaches. Join the conversation and learn how you can apply these patterns to build your own serverless consulting practice.
title: Building a Serverless Consulting Practice

abstract: It's a fact that at some point, something will break. Make sure that you are prepared. In this session, we dive deep into the requirements for a highly available and scalable architecture, and we show you how to deploy it. Achieving true availability involves a delicate balance among operations, security, development, and business. In this chalk talk, we show you where you might need to make business changes. We cover the technology you should be adopting, and we share the methodologies you should be teaching your engineers.
title: Letting Your Technology Break Without Concern

abstract: In this chalk talk, we start with building blocks for reliable event delivery in microservice architectures using DynamoDB and Lambda. We then discuss how to use these building blocks to implement eventually consistent transactional behavior and support for querying using Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) pattern in serverless microservices. Along the way, we discuss the tradeoffs and benefits of event-driven over request/response designs, and we go into the details of tuning DynamoDB and Lambda-based reliable delivery and processing pipelines for scale, performance, and cost.
title: Implementing Microservice Architectures with Amazon DynamoDB and AWS Lambda

abstract: AWS IoT and Amazon FreeRTOS set a high bar for transport layer security, which can overwhelm the capabilities of microcontrollers and embedded systems. In this session, we cover how to enable popular microcontrollers, Wi-Fi chipsets, and cryptocomponents to communicate with AWS IoT at minimal cost. Also, we compare and contrast different approaches for hardware solutions to enable AWS Greengrass devices to effectively communicate in a secure manner. We discuss microcontroller ecosystems, discrete components, and mature frameworks for development. Our goal is to help you understand and minimize bill of materials, or BOM, that goes into IoT hardware development.
title: AWS IoT - How Low Can You Go

abstract: Authentication is one of the most important parts of your IT estate to get right. In this chalk talk, we discuss the main approaches for designing an enterprise Windows and .NET authentication strategy and answer any questions you may have. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Designing an Enterprise Windows and .NET Authentication Strategy

abstract: Whether you’re using Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier as a backup target for database dumps, building a fully SEC-compliant archive, or something in between, AWS object storage offers a number of capabilities to ensure that your data stays retained, protected, and compliant with the rules of your business. This interactive session covers established best practices and new features to help you meet your retention requirements while minimizing storage costs.
title: Using Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier for Backup or Archive Storage

abstract: In this chalk talk, we cover the fundamentals of certificate management with AWS Certificate Manager (ACM), including new features that further simplify the validation process. We also discuss how to build and configure a private certificate authority for issuing certificates that are trusted within your organization. Finally, we walk through use cases and examples showing how customers use certificates to automate authentication and secure communications.
title: AWS Certificate Management and Private Certificate Authority Deep Dive

abstract: SFTP is a file exchange protocol that is deeply embedded in many enterprise applications across industries. If you've read this far, you likely already know that and are trying to figure out how you can (more) effectively run SFTP services in front of Amazon S3, potentially so you can migrate a key application to AWS. But you can't change your applications or break your client authentication schemes. Attend this session to learn an architecture and best practices with AWS-based tools that can simplify shifting (or improving) SFTP services to the cloud.
title: Donât Let SFTP Weigh Down Your Migration to the Cloud

abstract: In this session, discover how a major multinational Insurance company has improved the performance of their risk analysis calculations while reducing their cost using Amazon EC2 Spot Instances.
title: Optimizing Risk Analysis with Grid Computing on AWS

abstract: Amazon Elasticsearch Service has a rich set of security features that give you control over access to data in your domain. Whether you're using Amazon Cognito to integrate with your federated identity provider for a Kibana login, building a VPC application and integrating search, or using IAM for fine-grained access, you need to understand your options so you can keep your data safe. Leave this session with a practical set of tools for security.
title: Security in Amazon Elasticsearch Service

abstract: So you've built your SaaS application and now you're wondering what's next. What opportunities should I be thinking about in terms of maximizing the performance, cost, and scalability of my solution? How can I ensure that my multi-tenant storage model will scale? What should I be doing to ensure that one tenant can’t overload the system? These are among the many challenges and questions that SaaS architects face as they look at how to evolve their SaaS solutions and better align their architecture with the evolving needs of the business. In this chalk talk, targeted at those already deep in the weeds of SaaS, we explore strategies and patterns that being applied to optimize the performance of SaaS solutions on AWS.
title: Optimizing Your SaaS Architecture on AWS

abstract: Data is eating the world. Don't let it consume your organization! In this talk, we take a deep dive into the various methods of ingesting the ever-increasing amount of data that your organization is generating, and we discuss how to effectively leverage that data as part of your data analytics pipeline. We cover topics such as batch and real-time ingestion with AWS services and open source tools. We also dive into some reference architecture implementations of common ingestion patterns. Finally, we discuss how you can make this data useful through catalogs and governance.
title: Keeping the Pace with Data Ingestion

abstract: Retailers need to create individually tailored experiences to delight customers while more and more companies are leveraging technology to do so. In this chalk talk, we whiteboard the architecture and demonstrate Amazon Rekognition to understand how to automate the process of building personalized marketing solutions using ML-based machine vision and gather consumer insights using visualization tools. Audience participation is encouraged through a Q&A for retail marketing use cases like customer mood analysis, celebrity product placement marketing with social media, and store traffic analysis to drive merchandising decisions, planogram decisions, and overall product placement.
title: Retail Marketing with Machine Learning & Amazon Rekognition

abstract: Redis Streams is a new data type introduced in Redis 5.0 for message publishing and subscription. It differs from existing pub/sub components as it provides message persistence and primary/secondary data replication. Attend this session to learn about Redis Streams and discover how you can use it to build better messaging applications, such as chat, queues, and IoT.
title: Building a Messaging Application with Redis Streams

abstract: Plista, a Germany-based advertising solution provider, discusses how they use a cloud-native architecture, container-first approach to speed up development, increase agility, reduce latency, localize storage, and foster innovation and ownership in their organization. They demonstrate how a cloud blueprint is used to easily roll out their services to new global markets. With this architecture, Plista processes 1.7 billion requests per day, across four continents. They also discuss how they're adapting for GDPR compliance and redesigning parts of their platform to leverage new AWS services.
title: Go Global with Cloud-Native Architecture: Deploy AdTech Services Across Four Continents

abstract: Amazon Aurora offers several options for monitoring and optimizing MySQL database performance. These include Enhanced Monitoring and Performance Insights, an easy-to-use tool for assessing the load on your database and identifying slow-performing queries. In this session, learn how to tune the performance of your Aurora database with MySQL compatibility, whether your application is in development or in production.
title: Deep Dive on Amazon Aurora MySQL Performance Tuning

abstract: Safeguarding your information assets is critical for maintaining the confidence of your customers as well as protecting your organization’s own intellectual property. AWS offers a variety of cryptographic services that enable you to bring such protection down to the data level. In this session, we cover core AWS services, including AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS), AWS CloudHSM, and AWS Secrets Manager, discuss use cases for each, and show how these three services can be part of your corporate information security strategy.
title: Keeping Secrets: Securing Your Data with AWS Cryptography

abstract: Learn about the newly launched Amazon FSx for Lustre service. It's a fully managed file system that is optimized for compute-intensive workloads, such as high-performance computing, and machine learning. With Amazon FSx, you can launch and run a Lustre file system that can process massive data sets at up to hundreds of gigabytes per second of throughput, millions of IOPS, and sub-millisecond latencies. Come learn from AWS experts on how to get started with this new service.
title: Amazon FSx for Lustre Hands-on Deep DiveÂ

abstract: Building natural language processing (NLP) models just got easier and faster. Join us for a discussion with Emory University on implementing state-of-the-art NLP models using Apache MXNet and GluonNLP. Emory University shares best practices and key takeaways from developing their Evolution of Language and Information Technology (ELIT) platform on top of GluonNLP.
title: How Emory University Built an NLP Platform Using Apache MXNet and GluonNLP

abstract: Your system is composed of highly decoupled, independent, fast, and modular microservices. But how can they share common configurations, dynamic endpoints, database references, and properly rotate secrets? Based on the size and complexity of your serverless system, you may use AWS Lambda environment variables, AWS Systems Manager's Parameter Store, and the recently announced AWS Secrets Manager. In this session, we showcase the best use cases for each solution, as well as corresponding best practices to achieve the highest standards for security and performance.
title: Configuration Management and Service Discovery with AWS Lambda

abstract: How do you really know if someone is paying attention? There has never been an automated measure of body language. Body language doesn’t just tell you if someone is paying attention, it can also provide biomarkers of brain diseases or differences. In this session hear from Dr. Ned Sahin, a neuroscientist who has invented AI/ML methods to measure body language and mental-health biomarkers at a distance, for both clinical and business applications. He founded Brain Power to create AI systems to teach children with autism and other conditions how to better engage and socialize. He will show how you can more broadly apply a combination of Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Kinesis, and AWS DeepLens to analyze streaming video in real-time to measure audience attention to your content including movies, ads, TV shows, video games, political campaigns, speeches, online courses, or classroom teaching.
title: Can Deep Learning Be Used to Treat Disease and Measure Product Value?

abstract: Machine learning (ML) can help people with disabilities by using facial and object recognition, text-to-speech, automatic translation, and transcription to create assistive applications. In this chalk talk, learn how to assemble ML APIs from AWS to help people in new ways.
title: Improve Accessibility Using Machine Learning

abstract: In a short space of time, fast.ai has become a popular Deep Learning library, driven by the success of the fast.ai online Massive Open Online Course (MOOC). It has allowed SW developers to achieve, in the span of a few weeks, state-of-the-art results in domains such as Computer Vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and structured data machine learning. In this chalk talk, we go into the details of building, training, and deploying fast.ai-based models using Amazon SageMaker.
title: Building, Training, and Deploying fast.ai Models Using Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this session, we show you how to design connectivity between many VPCs and how new services interact with network architectures. We review common design patterns such as shared services VPCs, transit VPCs, private link, firewalls, and more. We also cover solutions to common challenges, such as VPN sprawl, keeping up with VPC automation, sharing services, and network segmentation at scale for hundreds of VPCs. Please join us for a speaker meet-and-greet following this session at the Speaker Lounge (ARIA East, Level 1, Willow Lounge). The meet-and-greet starts 15 minutes after the session and runs for half an hour.
title: Connecting Many VPCs: Network Design Patterns at Scale

abstract: Attend this chalk talk to learn how we use Amazon WorkSpaces to power the hands-on lab and certification environments at AWS re:Invent. During re:Invent 2018, tens of thousands of customers will come through the Hands-On Labs experience and use over one hundred thousand hours of lab time, all through Amazon WorkSpaces. We build the environment in three days, run it for a week, and tear it all down in an afternoon. This chalk talk provides the inside story for how we build the Amazon WorkSpaces environment to support the Hands-On Labs, from deployment to managing peak operations, and then to a fast and easy tear-down.
title: How Amazon WorkSpaces Powers the Hands-On Labs

abstract: In this session, we walk through building and deploying a global-scale, multi-region, active-active serverless backend using Amazon Route 53 to route the traffic among AWS Regions, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Lambda for the backend, and Amazon DynamoDB global tables for handling data storage at a global scale. We provide a demo and a hands-on coding opportunity.
title: Best Practices for Building Multi-Region, Active-Active Serverless Applications

abstract: Learn the concepts, best practices, blueprints and tips for migrating large enterprise Oracle databases to Amazon Aurora from an expert in the field. We use a combination of automated tools (AWS Schema Conversion Tool, AWS Database Migration Service), manual procedures, and DBA know-how. We take questions on the Amazon Aurora architecture and capabilities, how they compare to Oracle technologies such as RAC and DataGuard, and how to migrate core Oracle features, capabilities, and schema objects to their equivalent counterparts in AWS. We also share tips on choosing between PostgreSQL and MySQL as the target platform for your database.
title: Oracle to Amazon Aurora Migration, Step by Step

abstract: The appeal of SaaS has many ISVs interested in the power and value of delivering their solutions in a SaaS model. However, moving a single-tenant application to a multi-tenant environment can be daunting. In this session, we review the obstacles that many ISVs face as they consider the move to a SaaS delivery model. We explore a wide range of transformation patterns that cover everything from lift-and-shift of your monolith to an incremental cutover to multi-tenant-aware microservices, data, and infrastructure. Along the way, we highlight the challenges and technical considerations that shape your solution and enable you to better align your transformed solution with SaaS best practices. This includes looking at all the new architectural elements you need to add to your environment to support SaaS (onboarding, identity, billing, metering, analytics, and so on).
title: Migrating Single-Tenant Applications to Multi-Tenant SaaS

abstract: In this session, learn how to build a data-driven, serverless web application with real-time, offline, and data-syncing capabilities. Learn to power your applications using AWS AppSync how GraphQL APIs differ from REST-based APIs. We design an application that helps you manage a list of popular tourist destinations and provides real-time-weather information. The application is hosted on Amazon S3, and AWS AppSync provides the API layer. We show you how GraphQL technology can be used to provide real-time data from multiple sources, such as Amazon DynamoDB, Lambda, and HTTP endpoints.
title: Build Web Apps with GraphQL, AWS AppSync, and AWS Lambda

abstract: In this session, learn how OrangeX in Spain is transforming enterprise networks with AWS and Nokia’s Nuage SD-WAN, which is delivered with management, control, and user plane in the AWS Cloud. It is powered by EC2 i3.metal and AWS hybrid IT services, via true multi-tenant, built-in multi-segment orchestrators, and multi-tier management spanning from operators to partners to direct enterprise portals. With SD-WAN becoming an essential function in vCPE deployments, Nuage’s SD-WAN has been established as the platform for simplifying delivery and deployment of virtual network functions such as security and agility, on premises and in the cloud. Learn factors to consider in using SD-WAN with AWS, agile implementation of the solution, and leveraging a cloud-ready operating model. We share references to continue learning.
title: Interactive Zero-Touch Enterprise Networks: Nuage SD-WAN on AWS

abstract: It's no secret that voice with natural language processing has arrived. The way that humans interact with the digital world is fundamentally changing. Alexa for Business brings the same convenience and frictionless interaction that many Alexa users enjoy at home into the business world. In this chalk talk, we discuss how large organizations are using Alexa for Business to extract analytics and measure the health of their business using Alexa as a natural, voice-driven single pane of glass into curated views of their data lake and BI layer. Executives can get a flash briefing at the start of their day with key metrics describing the business' overall health, and then use private skills to drill down on that information, visualizing it via cards or through browser control. Gain an understanding of cards and ways to approach browser control, and build a basic private skill integration with Tableau using browser control.
title: View Business Metrics with Alexa for Business Private Skills

abstract: In this chalk, you gain hands-on experience with a number of development concepts involved in building enterprise-grade, voice-enablement solutions using Alexa for Business and Amazon Lex. You also learn best practices in architecting and securing Alexa and Amazon Lex solutions in enterprise environments. This is an advanced, technical, hands-on lab for developers with basic knowledge of AWS Lambda.
title: Develop Enterprise Voice Solutions with Alexa for Business & Amazon Lex

abstract: Games push the boundaries of tech, and we can learn from them for a wide range of use cases. In this session, we look at what makes an Alexa quiz game, interactive fiction, and companion games work. Learn how to build engaging experiences with dialog management and entity resolution (Alexa NLU), session persistence (Amazon DynamoDB), production value (SSML, Amazon S3), as well as state handling, multi-modal displays, interceptors (ASK SDK), and cross-device interactions (Gadgets, AWS IoT for PC games).
title: Supercharge Any Alexa Skill by Understanding What Games Do

abstract: Streamlining individual processes and shortening deployment times are key to bring efficiencies in manufacturing. This becomes even more critical in specialized products like dental implants. Dental offices need to deploy special equipment to address the complex processes of scanning, measuring, and milling that are expensive. In this chalk talk, you’ll hear from Glidewell Laboratories, a vertically integrated dental product provider specializing in crowns and implants. Glidewell is using AI/ML services from AWS to streamline and simplify the process of developing, manufacturing, and fitting crowns for patients. You’ll learn how Glidewell built and deployed a neural network to automatically generate new dental crown designs, enabling them to bypass multiple manual steps and simplify the process of developing, manufacturing, and fitting crowns for their patients. Learn how to adapt the process Glidewell has developed for manufacturing to shorten deployment times and provide positive business outcomes.
title: Manufacturing Better Smiles with Neural Networks

abstract: Organizations building applications that handle confidential or sensitive data are subject to many types of regulatory requirements, and they often rely on hardware security modules (HSMs) to provide validated control of encryption keys and cryptographic operations. AWS CloudHSM is a cloud-based HSM that enables you to easily generate and use your own encryption keys on the AWS Cloud using FIPS 140-2 Level 3 validated HSMs. This talk demonstrates best practices in configuring and scaling your CloudHSM cluster, implementing cross-region disaster recovery, and optimizing throughput.
title: Deep Dive on AWS CloudHSM

abstract: Many AWS customers today run compute workloads in Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS-managed containers at the same time. Amazon Route 53 provides a unified service discovery that helps services running on top of Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS easily discover each other. In this session, we review a set of best practices for consistent services names management across Amazon ECS, Amazon EKS, and self-managed Kubernetes, bridging the gap in naming and service discovery for the majority of container-based workloads run on top of AWS.
title: Unifying Service Naming and Discovery Across Amazon EKS and ECS

abstract: Join us as we introduce Amazon SageMaker Neo, a new capability of Amazon SageMaker that enables machine learning (ML) models to train once and run anywhere in the cloud or at the edge. ML models are trained and tuned to be accurate and deliver the right predictions. A critical aspect of these models is about performance. Developers spend a lot of time and effort to produce a model that runs efficiently on the target hardware platform. SageMaker Neo removes the barriers holding back developers from running and deploying models in the most optimized manner. With SageMaker Neo, ML models are optimized to run up to two times faster and consume less than a hundredth of the resources compared to typical models. Neo automatically optimizes models built on TensorFlow, Apache MXNet, PyTorch, ONNX, and XGboost and can be deployed on multiple hardware platforms including ARM, Intel, and Nvidia. In this chalk talk, we will dive deep into Amazon SageMaker Neo, where we will discuss the innovation driving the optimization and making machine learning models easy to train and deploy across hardware platforms.
title: Introducing Amazon SageMaker Neo: Train Once Run Anywhere in the Cloud or at the Edge

abstract: In this chalk talk, we review the program for GxP Compliance/Validated systems in the cloud and present several examples of validated solutions on AWS. We also review the collateral available and services used for delivery. Learn what AWS can provide for validated systems and best practices for continuous compliance in the cloud.
title: Architecting for GxP Compliance in Life Sciences

abstract: When it comes to running SQL Server, both Amazon EC2 and Amazon RDS are great options. Join us for this chalk talk where we baseline the two alternatives and answer all of your questions regarding which platform is the best choice for your scenario. This is an interactive question and answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Finding the Best Fit: Deploying SQL Server on Amazon RDS & Amazon EC2

abstract: Deploying frequently is fundamental to reducing the feedback loop and increasing developer productivity. There are multiple features available in AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) that you can use to implement a continuous deployment pipeline with safe deployment strategies, such as canary releases. In this session, we review the possible options applied to different scenarios, such as microservices architectures, chaos engineering, and A/B testing to discover the best practices for your use cases. We also discuss how teams at Capital One created a deployment pipeline using AWS SAM and AWS CodeDeploy for canary deployments for the Capital One Credit Offers API, which is built on Golang and AWS Lambda.
title: Best Practices for Safe Deployments on AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway

abstract: There are a myriad of ways to get your file-based data into Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS, from the simple AWS command line tools and similar script-based approaches to proprietary commercial tools built for media workflows. Attend this session to learn about an architecture and associated tips and tricks that enable you to improve data transfer performance—scaling out with parallel streams—without the manual labor of extensive scripting or the cost of third-party licensed software.
title: Move Data to AWS Faster for Migrations, DR, & Bidirectional Workflows

abstract: In this talk, get a behind-the-scenes look at how an AWS service team builds and operates the production APIs and services that power the AWS Serverless Application Repository. We discuss the best practices we have discovered from building and operating a completely serverless backend. Hear tips for managing serverless development projects, building APIs, processing streaming data, and monitoring production applications.
title: Lessons Learned from Building an AWS Service on AWS Lambda

abstract: AWS Lambda launched support for Amazon SQS as an event source. Join this session to learn about best practices to help you integrate serverless applications using Amazon SQS. We explore how to tune Lambda and Amazon SQS to scale your existing applications without having to worry about provisioning capacity. We also discuss how to bridge high-scale serverless applications with limited server-full applications such as relational databases.
title: Best Practices for Queue Processing in Serverless Applications

abstract: Learn about the newly launched Amazon FSx for Windows File Server service. It's a fully managed native Microsoft Windows file system so you can easily move your Windows-based applications that require file storage to AWS. Built on Windows Server, Amazon FSx provides shared file storage with the compatibility and features that your Windows-based applications rely on. Come learn from AWS experts on how to get started with this new service.
title: Amazon FSx for Windows File Server Hands-on Deep Dive

abstract: In this session, we discuss an AWS network design for multiple traffic streams, such as production, non-production, and PCI data (or regulated data) using AWS Direct Connect and Direct Connect gateway. We show you how to do this while keeping the traffic segregated at the network layer.
title: Designing Network Architectures with Direct Connect for Multiple Traffic Streams

abstract: Many companies are modernizing their applications through the use of microservices to democratize software development, providing greater agility in their software delivery pipelines. Developers building their applications using a microservices strategy need persistent container storage that is highly available, easy to provision, and can scale up and down without storage admin intervention. In this session, we discuss CloudBees Core (formerly Enterprise Jenkins) and how it is using Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) for simple, scalable, on-demand persistent container storage to support customer CI/CD workflows. Bring questions, prepare to discuss your implementation, and expect to have a deep discussion on how you can optimize your own deployment.
title: Using Cloud File Storage to Accelerate Your Software Development Pipeline

abstract: Amazon EMR helps you process all your data for analytics, but with great scale comes great responsibility—you need to make sure that data is secured by design. In this chalk talk, we walk through how to configure your environment to take full advantage of comprehensive security controls: including identifying sensitive data, encrypting data and managing keys, authenticating and authorizing users, utilizing fine-grained access controls, and using audit logs to demonstrate compliance.
title: Lock It Down: Configure End-to-End Security & Access Control on Amazon EMR

abstract: For a wide variety of metrics—including business metrics, application metrics, and low-level software and hardware metrics—it is critical to detect abnormalities to ensure that you end up with the right data. In this chalk talk, learn about the Random Cut Forest algorithm built into Amazon SageMaker in order to detect anomalies. We dive deep into detecting anomalies and tuning data in order to find practical solutions.
title: Detect Anomalies Using Amazon SageMaker

abstract: One of the main challenges customers face is running efficient deep learning training over multiple nodes. In this chalk talk, Uber discusses how to use Horovod, a distributed training framework, to speed up deep learning training on TensorFlow and PyTorch.
title: Uber on Using Horovod for Distributed Deep Learning

abstract: In this session, learn about the latest features in our cost management tooling. The presentation is given by the Cost Insights service team and supported by cost optimization experts from across our business.
title: Cost Optimization Tooling

abstract: Take a deep dive into the newer services available in 2018 for AWS IoT. In this session, we look at new features added to AWS IoT Core and AWS Greengrass with Edge ML, and then deep dive into AWS IoT Analytics, AWS Device Management, and AWS IoT Device Defender. Learn more about when to use some of these services and explore comparisons between them.
title: Deep Dive into New AWS IoT Services Launched in 2018
