The governance at scale solution provides customers an enterprise governance “blueprint” that enable organizations to move faster, and with increased confidence, to AWS.
title: Governance at Scale

abstract: Automatic video transcription and translation can help make videos more available and accessible to a global audience in many languages, enabling your employees or customers to access, understand, and benefit from your content. In this chalk talk, we discuss how to transcribe videos, translate them in the required languages in a multilingual application, and enable video search in the viewer’s preferred language—all in an automated and cost-effective manner.
title: Powering Multilingual Video Transcription, Translation, and Search

abstract: In IT environments, identity is the key to governance and security. In this session, we discuss the challenges with identity in hybrid environments and some of the solutions. Topics include identity lifecycle management, single sign-on, multi-factor authentication, and dealing with multiple identity providers from different parties. We also cover the security requirements of a hybrid cloud environment: maintaining visbility, encryption, secure remote access, and compliance and auditing requirements.
title: Hybrid Identity Management and Security for Large Enterprises

abstract: Are you interested in training and running your machine learning models on Windows? Are you unsure of how to get your data from Microsoft SQL Server to Amazon SageMaker? In this session, we focus on the patterns and practices for machine learning on Windows. This is an interactive question-and-answer session. Please bring your questions, and join us for this discussion.
title: Windows Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence

abstract: In this session, we explore Amazon ElastiCache for Redis as an in-memory data store and cache service, and we use it to build a real-time sales analytics dashboard. We guide the participants through building the solution that integrates Amazon Kinesis, Amazon Elastic Container Service, AWS Lambda, and Amazon ElastiCache to create a dashboard that provides a near real-time display of information, even at high volume.
title: Build a Real-Time Sales Analytics Dashboard with Amazon ElastiCache for Redis

abstract: Running your open source database on Amazon EC2 is convenient, but can it be easier, more scalable, and more cost effective? You bet it can. In this session, learn how to effectively and efficiently migrate a read/write-heavy MySQL database from Amazon EC2 to Amazon Aurora with zero downtime, increased availability from 99.95% to 99.999%, and reduction of cost by 5X.
title: Migrating Open Source Databases from Amazon EC2 to Aurora MySQL

abstract: Data processing, exploitation, and dissemination (PED) is mission-critical for warfighters and analysts. Video data in particular can yield vital information and context, and government agencies spend millions of dollars annually gathering it. Yet extracting the full intelligence potential of the data during the PED process has proven to be a challenge due to error-prone and bandwidth-constrained networks, as well as overall poor image quality. Join the team that built the glass-to-glass workflow for the USD(I)-governed and NGA-led 2018 Enterprise Challenge event, showcasing HD contribution feeds using ruggedized small form factor encoders in the field, ingesting feeds into the AWS Cloud for packaging, and delivering to multiscreen devices to improve intelligence gathering for the warfighter. Learn about best practices, hurdles in architecting the solution, and how these technologies are refining the intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) landscape.
title: Insights into the Government Glass-to-Glass Video Workflows

abstract: Containers help you package your code so it can reliably run anywhere. However, deploying containers in the cloud can be complex and requires you to set up and manage multiple systems. In this chalk talk, learn how Amazon Lightsail makes it easy to start using containers with AWS. We cover when you should use Lightsail to run and scale containerized web apps and how to migrate from Lightsail to container services like Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS.
title: Getting Started with Containers Using Amazon Lightsail

abstract: Media and entertainment companies are navigating their own digital transformation strategies, and they want to make their editors, artists, and VFX compositing teams comfortable with using the cloud for their production workflows. Over the top streaming providers are on track to spend over $20B on original content this year and these productions all share similar storage challenges. In this chalk talk, learn how AWS Storage Gateway can help studios and other media and entertainment firms bridge the storage gap between the cloud and their on-premises editorial environments.
title: Bridge the Storage Gap: Hybrid Media Workflows with AWS Storage Gateway

abstract: Have you wondered what it takes to build a serverless .NET application? In this chalk talk, we outline serverless computing for .NET applications and answer all of your questions about how to build and deploy .NET applications on AWS Lambda. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Deploying Serverless .NET Applications

abstract: What are the approaches to migrating to Neptune? Learn how to migrate data from an existing relational or graph database into Neptune. See examples of Gremlin and SPARQL queries with Neptune.
title: Migrating to Amazon Neptune

abstract: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) has been endorsed by government and industry as a recommended baseline for use by any organization, regardless of sector or size, to implement risk management best practices and achieve desired security outcomes. In this chalk talk, we discuss how organizations can use AWS to align to the CSF by providing a detailed breakout of AWS services and associated customer responsibilities (security in the cloud) and AWS responsibilities (security of the cloud).
title: Aligning to the NIST Cybersecurity Framework in the AWS Cloud

abstract: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into best practices for Kinesis Data Streams and how to optimize for low-latency, multi-consumer solutions. Please join us for a speaker meet-and-greet following this session at the Speaker Lounge (ARIA East, Level 1, Willow Lounge). The meet-and-greet starts 15 minutes after the session and runs for half an hour.
title: Using Amazon Kinesis Data Streams as a Low-Latency Message Bus

abstract: Learn how companies like FocusCura and Clouden have on-boarded hierarchical data at scale using Amazon Cloud Directory, a highly available, fully managed, serverless, hierarchical datastore. It’s well-suited for such use cases as human resources applications, course catalogs, device registry, network topology, and any application that needs fine-grained permissions (authorization). We do a deep dive into the internals of Cloud Directory and discuss best practices.
title: Amazon Cloud Directory Deep Dive

abstract: AWS IoT Analytics collects, processes, and analyzes IoT data so you can gain operational insights. To collect data and prepare it for analysis, you use channels that listen to devices and pull device messages into AWS IoT Analytics. Once messages are flowing, pipelines process and turn them into useful data using transforms and filters. Pipelines enrich your IoT data with data from other AWS services and external data sources. Processed data is stored in an IoT-optimized data store. Once data is ready to be analyzed, data sets are created by querying the data or using built-in Jupyter Notebook templates for sophisticated analytics like machine learning (ML). AWS IoT Analytics integrates with Amazon SageMaker so you can build ML models. In this session, we deep dive on these components.
title: Building IoT Analytics

abstract: When you move your data center to the AWS Cloud, you need an innovative and cost-effective approach to ensure a successful transition. In this chalk talk, we discuss how to efficiently and securely migrate all of your data center workloads to the AWS Cloud. Hear how one customer, LoanLogics, started with AWS Storage Gateway and Amazon EFS to solve an immediate and urgent expansion challenge and used that as a starting point for their journey to the AWS Cloud. Hear how they took advantage of the agility of the cloud to transition their storage and database workloads to Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS. Learn tips to ease your own transition to the cloud. Bring your questions, prepare to discuss your implementation, and expect to have a deep discussion on how you can optimize your workflows.
title: Kickstart Your All-In Move to the AWS Cloud Using AWS Storage Gateway and Amazon EFS

abstract: Veritas Technologies is an AWS Partner Network (APN) Advanced Technology Partner that addresses information management challenges, including backup and recovery, business continuity, software-defined storage, and information governance to simplify backup and improve efficiency. In this chalk talk, we do a deep dive on Veritas NetBackup, an industry-leading backup software that protects on-premises and Amazon EC2 workloads and provides support for Amazon S3 Standard-Infrequent Access and Amazon Glacier. We also hear from Bell Media, who is utilizing Veritas NetBackup to retain backups long-term on Amazon S3.
title: Enterprise Data Protection with Veritas NetBackup on AWS

abstract: Launch templates are a new way to interact with Amazon EC2. They allow Amazon EC2 customers to define a configuration, persist it, and reuse it across many Amazon EC2 products/APIs. In this chalk talk, we look into specifics of launch templates, various scenarios and use cases, and how to use them with Amazon EC2 RunInstances, Spot Fleet, and Auto Scaling APIs. With launch templates, we are truly reinventing Amazon EC2. Join us and discover how you can achieve the benefits of launch templates.
title: Reinventing Amazon EC2 Instance Launches with Launch Templates

abstract: Deploying a new version of your Alexa Skill Lambda function is always a risk. For example, you risk introducing an error in your code or a human error in the deployment process. In this talk, we show you how to minimize these risks. First, we show you how to automate your deployment workflow, from the commit of the change in your source code repository to the deployment of the Lambda function. We then show you how to automatically test your code deployment and, when the test passes, to progressively shift Alexa customers' traffic from the old version of your Lambda function to the new version. This enables you to quickly roll back your deployment in the unlikely case that you introduced a bug in the new version.
title: Automate Your Alexa Lambda Function Deployment Workflows Using AWS CodeCommit

abstract: Networking is the foundation supporting many applications and services on AWS. As such, it is one of the first and most important things to consider when architecting with AWS. In this session, we discuss planning for your advanced AWS networking architectures.
title: Planning Advanced AWS Networking Architectures

abstract: What if you could enhance seismic data with nothing but a few well-logged datasets using machine learning (ML) to automatically predict porosity, permeability, density, and any other lithology data in real time? Today, much of the analysis in exploration is done manually, which is tedious and error-prone. There are endless applications for these insights, from upstream to downstream. In this session, we demonstrate how Amazon SageMaker can automate tasks to extract deeper insights to power better decisions and to reduce interpretation time from months to days. We also engage in a discussion about some of the applications for ML in oil and gas, including improving safety outcomes, improving asset management and maintenance, and optimizing well placement.
title: Transforming the Upstream Oil and Gas with AWS ML Solutions

abstract: Questions often arise about training machine learning models using Amazon SageMaker with data from sources other than Amazon S3. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into training models in real time using data from Amazon DynamoDB or a relational database. We demonstrate how training models with Amazon SageMaker is quick and easy, regardless of the data source.
title: Train Models on Amazon SageMaker Using Data Not from Amazon S3

abstract: Are you considering a hybrid VMware Cloud on AWS architecture for your Microsoft workloads? In this chalk talk, we cover how to architect Microsoft workloads for the VMware Cloud on AWS, and we answer all of your questions about how the VMware Cloud on AWS can be used for Microsoft workloads. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Running Hybrid Microsoft Applications on VMware Cloud on AWS

abstract: In this chalk talk, we show you how to build a connected, frictionless retail checkout experience, inspired by Amazon Go. We briefly explain the user experience, technical specifications, and we then delve into the implementation details of the project. We show you how to create SSD Object Detection and Visual Search models in Amazon SageMaker with the details of the end-to-end lifecycle of the dataset, including creation, training, tuning and deployment. We also, show you how to write AWS Lambda functions for IoT edge devices with AWS Greengrass, and how AWS Greengrass can interact simultaneously with IoT sensors, such as a door or weight. Finally, we explain the details of a sensor fusion algorithm that combines the data to the customer purchase transaction.
title: Create a Frictionless, Connected Retail Checkout Experience Inspired by Amazon Go

abstract: Blue/green deployment is a technique used to release applications by shifting traffic between two identical environments running different versions of an application. Come and learn how AWS Elastic Beanstalk makes blue/green deployments easy and helps you mitigate common risks associated with deploying software while avoiding downtime.
title: Use Elastic Beanstalk Blue/Green Deployment to Reduce Downtime & Risk

abstract: Are you considering using AWS Lambda with your RDS/RDBMS solutions but don’t know where to start? In this session, we look at recommended architectural patterns and best practices around using RDS/RDBMS solutions with Lambda functions. We also discuss migration steps—covering migration from on-premises RDBMS solutions to AWS serverless infrastructure keeping the same RDBMS application model. Come and join our discussion, ask questions, and learn more about using Lambda with RDS/RDBMS solutions.
title: Best Practices for Using AWS Lambda with RDS/RDBMS Solutions

abstract: In this session, learn best practices and tips for migrating SQL Server databases to Amazon Aurora. We use a combination of automated tools such as AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) and AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS), manual procedures, and DBA know-how. We take questions on Amazon Aurora architecture and capabilities, how they compare to Microsoft technologies, and how to migrate core SQL Server features, capabilities, and schema objects to their AWS equivalent counterparts.
title: SQL Server to Amazon Aurora Migration, Step by Step

abstract: AWS IoT Analytics is a fully managed service that makes it easy to run and operationalize sophisticated analytics on massive volumes of IoT data. In this session, we demonstrate how AWS IoT Analytics can help you incorporate the power of ambient intelligence into your IoT workflow and extract valuable insights from your generated IoT data. In addition, as we walk you through a specific example, we describe each of the service components, how to use them, and general best practices.
title: Ambient Intelligence - Bringing ML and AI to the Connected Home

abstract: For every game that game studios develop, they implement server-side logic and validation for almost every interaction with the game clients. This is to detect anomalous behavior and patterns before committing them to a data store. In addition to increasing development time and costs per game, slow responses can also ruin the player experience. In this chalk talk, we discuss how game studios can improve anomaly detection using a central trained machine learning (ML) model built using Amazon SageMaker.
title: Detect Anomalies & Fraud in Your Games Using Amazon SageMaker & ML

abstract: Come to this session to discuss the recent release of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Protection Act. We review why the AWS Big Data Competency now requests information on your strategy for supporting data governance within your software (ISV) or in your architectures (SI). We also review the ISVs in our new Data Governance category and discuss how you might want to partner with them for success.
title: Big Data Governance in a Post-GDPR World

abstract: There are unique challenges to building highly accurate models that detect small objects in aerial and overhead imagery. In this chalk talk, we dive deep into using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) with Amazon SageMaker in order to build and train aerial object detection models. We build advanced models using AWS public datasets, such as SpaceNet and LandSat, as we work with DigitalGlobe's GBDX Notebooks.
title: Build Models for Aerial Images Using Amazon SageMaker

abstract: Interested in learning more about microservice architectures for .NET applications running on AWS? In this chalk talk, we baseline .NET microservices architectures and answer all of your questions about .NET and microservices on AWS. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Modernizing Windows Applications with Containers

abstract: Build (or test!) your DynamoDB chops in this chalk talk where we work together to design data models and solutions for real-world use cases using DynamoDB. Share your experiences and best practices, and ask questions of DynamoDB experts.
title: Real-World Use Cases for Amazon DynamoDB

abstract: You store some of your most critical data at AWS. That data needs to be available to the application no matter what, and it must not be lost. In this session, we explain how to take your conventional data center's high-availability architecture to AWS, and we show you how you can rely on Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) to help you do it. We go into detail on how to use the features in Amazon RDS MySQL and Amazon Aurora MySQL for unparalleled high availability and disaster recovery to keep your applications available and responsive.
title: MySQL High Availability & Disaster Recovery

abstract: In this session, learn from the team that migrated Amazon’s inventory and fulfillment management systems (AFT) from Oracle to Amazon Aurora. We focus on the performance and cost benefits to enterprises that migrate critical systems from Oracle to AWS services; the decision frameworks used to pick Amazon Aurora; and best practices in system design and project management.
title: How Amazon.com Migrates Inventory Management Systems

abstract: Amazon Aurora Serverless is a configuration for Aurora (MySQL-compatible edition) where the database automatically starts up, shuts down, and scales capacity up or down based on your application's needs. In this session, we discuss how Aurora Serverless supports infrequent, intermittent, or unpredictable workloads, and we provide tips for building your next application on a serverless database. Please join us for a speaker meet-and-greet following this session at the Speaker Lounge (ARIA East, Level 1, Willow Lounge). The meet-and-greet starts 15 minutes after the session and runs for half an hour.
title: Going Deep on Amazon Aurora Serverless

abstract: In this talk, we outline the challenges of embedded IoT development and highlight how Amazon FreeRTOS helps to solve them.
title: Challenges of Embedded IoT Development and How Amazon FreeRTOS is Changing the Scene

abstract: In this talk, we share a real-world experience of how AWS securely implements Kubernetes network abstractions at scale. We also explore the pain points in the current Kubernetes networking design, best practices for troubleshooting, and future improvements.
title: Kubernetes Networking in Amazon EKS

abstract: Companies have valuable data that they might not be analyzing due to the complexity, scalability, and performance issues of loading the data into their data warehouse. With the right tools, you can extend your analytics to query data in your data lake—with no loading required. Amazon Redshift Spectrum extends the analytic power of Amazon Redshift beyond data stored in your data warehouse to run SQL queries directly against vast amounts of unstructured data in your Amazon S3 data lake. This gives you the freedom to store your data where you want, in the format you want, and have it available for analytics when you need it. Join a discussion with an Amazon Redshift lead engineer to ask questions and learn more about how you can extend your analytics beyond your data warehouse.
title: Extending Analytics Beyond the Data Warehouse, ft. Warner Bros. Analytics

abstract: Database migrations are an important step in any journey to AWS. In this session, we show you how to get started with AWS Database Migration Service (AWS DMS) and AWS Schema Conversion Tool (AWS SCT) to quickly and securely migrate your databases to AWS. Learn how to simplify your database migrations by using this service to migrate your data to and from commercial and open-source databases. We also explain how you can perform homogenous migrations such as MySQL to MySQL, as well as heterogeneous migrations between different database platforms, such as Oracle to Amazon Aurora.
title: Database Migration Using AWS DMS and AWS SCT

abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss delivering instant demos and trials of your desktop applications. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed application streaming service that lets you deliver your applications to a browser on any computer. You don't need to spend hours on software installation and system setup for each customer. We walk through common AppStream 2.0 approaches for application delivery, user management, networking, billing, storage, and scaling.
title: Deliver Instant Demos and Trials of Your Desktop Application with AppStream 2.0

abstract: In Financial Services, payments have evolved from a commodity into a key differentiator, driven by customer demand for faster, easier, and more seamless payment processing. Expectations from regulators for PCI DSS-compliant workloads have evolved with increased focus on risk reduction, transparency, and standardization. In this space, the need to replace legacy systems, address security concerns, and support a highly seasonal 24/7/365 operation present barriers to innovation. In this chalk talk, we examine how our customers address these concerns by using the AWS Cloud to rapidly build their own scalable payment systems, leveraging PCI DSS-compliant AWS services across compute, database, analytics, and security. Together, we explore traditional design patterns based on our PCI DSS Quick Start, as well as the evolution to managed services, microservices, and serverless services.
title: Disrupting Traditional Payment Systems Architecture with AWS

abstract: Learn how a major auto manufacturer accelerated their design simulation time from days to hours and made it possible to turn around large design studies and training data faster by using Amazon EC2 GPU-powered instances.
title: Transforming Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) with GPUs on AWS

abstract: Amazon SageMaker enables you to bring your existing Apache MXNet or TensorFlow script for your machine learning models. In this session, we walk through the details of bringing your own script for training your models at scale. We also go into detail on using local containers for repeated experiments for ease of use and scalability.
title: Bring Your Own Apache MXNet and TensorFlow Scripts to Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this session, learn how to use AWS IoT Device Management to onboard and manage devices at scale. We discuss a customer use case, provide a demo, and share best practices to solve the fleet management challenges that you may be facing.
title: The Essentials of AWS IoT Device Management

abstract: Do you have questions about your SQL Server migration that need answers? In this chalk talk, we lay out the fundamental choices for migrating SQL Server databases to AWS, and we answer all of your questions about how to approach and execute your migration. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Designing a Migration Strategy for Your SQL Server Infrastructure

abstract: Amazon Aurora offers several options for monitoring and optimizing PostgreSQL database performance. These include Enhanced Monitoring and Performance Insights, an easy-to-use tool for assessing the load on your database and identifying slow-performing queries. In this session, learn how to tune the performance of your Aurora database with PostgreSQL compatibility, whether your application is in development or in production.
title: Deep Dive on Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL Performance Tuning

abstract: Have you wondered what best practices are for running Microsoft workloads on AWS? In this chalk talk, we cover the most important best practices for running Microsoft workloads on AWS and answer any questions that you may have. This is an interactive question-and-answer session, so please bring your questions and join us for this discussion.
title: Designing Well-Architected Microsoft Workloads in AWS

abstract: Virtual reality (VR) is redefining how companies engage with customers and present their products and services. In this session, experts from AWS and leaders from ThingLogix provide a technical deep dive on an innovative VR experience created for VMware. The VR-based experience provides a new, immersive way to learn about VMmare Cloud services while also providing a real-time demonstration of how Amazon Sumerian integrates with Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, and AWS IoT services. Attendees learn how to replicate this experience across use cases and industries to create powerful ways to convey information and engage audiences.
title: How ThingLogix Redefined the Conference Experience for VMworld Attendees

abstract: AWS offers a broad range of purpose-built services, such as databases, analytics, search, and visualization. Attend this session to learn how you can integrate the fully-managed Redis service offered by AWS, which includes search and graph services to build modern applications.
title: Overview of Redis with Search and Graph

abstract: Many organizations have remote operations that are disconnected from corporate networks and the AWS Cloud. These operations, whether they are mines, ships, farms, or remote industrial sites, often need to do critical processing before they ship data back to AWS. Join this interactive chalk talk with the AWS engineering team to understand how the AWS Snowball Edge service can help you capture, preprocess, and migrate data into and out of AWS where you don't have reliable or adequate network connectivity. In particular, we discuss the details of running Amazon EC2 instances and AWS Lambda functions on Snowball Edge for common and emerging edge compute applications.
title: Edge Computing Use Cases: Interactive Deep Dive on AWS Snowball Edge

abstract: This session dives into strategies using AWS Global Accelerator to help you build a high availability architecture for your services on AWS. It will include an overview of our new AWS Global Accelerator, which enables you to manage multi-regional endpoints using static IP addresses anycast from our edge network around the world. You will learn about the service architecture in depth and how AWS Global Accelerator mitigates various failure modes to provide for global resiliency and to reduce cross customer impact.
title: AWS Global Accelerator Deep Dive for Building Highly Available Services

abstract: Amazon EMR is a powerful service, enabling you to process and analyze big data at any scale. In this chalk talk, we share proven strategies to maximize your utilization while minimizing your costs for long-running clusters. We discuss how to get the most leverage from features like Auto Scaling and Spot pricing. We also discuss how changing your design architecture decoupling of compute and storage impacts TCO. Not least, appropriately sizing instances, clusters, and jobs will help you save.
title: Lower Costs on Amazon EMR: Auto Scaling, Spot Pricing, & Expert Strategies

abstract: Games are a large target for DDoS attacks, and outages can be costly and damaging for a game's reputation and a player’s experience. Traditionally, mitigating DDoS attacks has been an expensive process, requiring many people to manage and support it. In this session, we look at how to design your backend architecture to automatically identify and mitigate DDoS attacks. We explore ways to incorporate services such as AWS Shield to help manage attacks and AWS WAF to deflect unwanted traffic. For game servers, we learn how Amazon GameLift can help minimize the attack surface and blast radius of your multiplayer games.
title: Building a DDoS-Resilient Architecture for Your Games

abstract: Dive into over-the-air (OTA) updates with Amazon FreeRTOS. Amazon FreeRTOS makes deploying OTA updates for microcontroller-based devices less memory-intensive by communicating those updates over a single TLS connection shared with other AWS IoT Core communications. You provide a firmware image, select the devices to update, select a code signing method, and schedule the update, all within the AWS IoT Device Management Console. You can use OTA updates to deploy security updates, bug fixes, and new firmware updates to devices in the field.
title: Update Microcontroller Devices Over-the-Air with Amazon FreeRTOS

abstract: In this chalk talk, we explore the implementation details of achieving availability and reliability, as described in the whitepaper, AWS Well-Architected Framework - Reliability Pillar. Please join us for a speaker meet-and-greet following this session at the Speaker Lounge (ARIA East, Level 1, Willow Lounge). The meet-and-greet starts 15 minutes after the session and runs for half an hour.
title: Reliability of the Cloud: How AWS Achieves High Availability

abstract: Learn about new the Amazon EC2 instances that offer AMD EPYC CPUs. We provide a technical overview and discuss how the new M5a, R5a, and T3a instance types fit into the Amazon EC2 product family. We then deep dive into which workloads customers should use the new instances to better optimize their utilization and costs.
title: Overview of the New Amazon EC2 Instances with AMD EPYC

abstract: Amazon DynamoDB global tables provide you with a fully managed, multi-region, and mutli-master database. With global tables, you can replicate table data to multiple AWS Regions for higher availability and provide your applications local access to DynamoDB tables for fast read and write performance. In this chalk talk, we dive deep on keys to success when designing global tables. Learn how to manage throughput capacity for your global table correctly and get a deep understanding of how global tables replication works. We also walk through reference architectures and examples that you can take with you to help you build and optimize your own global applications.
title: How Amazon Video Uses DynamoDB Global Tables to Support Tens of Millions of Global Viewers

abstract: In this chalk talk, global bearing manufacturer SKF demonstrates how they use AWS IoT to provide real-time insights into their global customers worldwide to optimize machine health and reduce costs for end users, while opening up new revenue models for SKF. SKF is driving Industry 4.0 within their own factories, with a new joint interaction between Operations, and IT. Here, a new culture of agile development, driven by value creation, bridges manufacturing Operations and IT. For example, the need to monitor and connect the large number of legacy manufacturing machines in the field today was designed using AWS Greengrass and self-developed connectors, all made available on SKF’s Digital Platform. Developing a use case with AWS ensures reusability within SKF for other applications.
title: AWS & Manufacturing: SKF Connects Smart Products with Smart Factories

abstract: AI is at the center of a shift in how applications are developed and how users interact with data. Code that writes itself, voice enablement, computer vision, and activation by presence are some of the ways the human-to-computer interfaces are evolving. This chalk talk, we explore this evolution and show you how AWS AI services have impacted specific industries, such as manufacturing and development. Additionally, participants have an opportunity to get hands-on with an interactive art display powered by AWS AI services. Our goal is to show you how AI can help you reimagine your applications, services, interfaces, and business.
title: How AI is Reimagining Software, Environments, Apps, & Programmatic Interfaces

abstract: The world is powered by many monolithic applications that were written many years ago. These applications have complicated code bases. They are also difficult to maintain, deploy, and operate. The cloud, microservices, and serverless provide agility, efficiency, and resiliency. In this chalk talk, we highlight various approaches for rearchitecting three-tier monoliths to serverless microservices for your customers.
title: Ripping off the Bandage: Re-Architecting Traditional Three-Tier Monoliths to Serverless

abstract: In this session, learn how to run your Oracle database on Amazon RDS. We discuss various Oracle database options, as well as high availability, backup, and upgrades. We also cover database migration to Amazon RDS for Oracle.
title: Running Your Oracle Database on Amazon RDS

abstract: Enterprises increasingly segregate workloads (or teams) into multiple AWS accounts as a best practice for security and billing purposes. Some enterprises even have healthy security budgets largely driven by legal requirements. But, what do you do if you don't have a regulatory imperative and the budget that comes with it? This session discusses Turner's journey from a handful of accounts to a secure, multi-account AWS environment. We discuss how we automate and audit across a global organization using almost exclusively native AWS tools.
title: Turnerâs Journey to Scale Securely on a Lean Budget

abstract: In this session, we share the top 10 lessons learned from migrating the online transaction processing (OLTP) and data warehouse (DW) databases used by Amazon.com to AWS services, such as Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS), Amazon Aurora, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon DynamoDB. We discuss the challenges associated with operating and managing legacy OLTP and DW databases at Amazon.com scale and how the Amazon.com team successfully executed the database freedom program across different organizations and geographies.
title: The Amazon.com Database Journey to AWS â Top 10 Lessons Learned

abstract: Developers live by their tools. In this chalk talk, we build an AWS CloudFormation template authoring environment by reviewing various IDEs, validation plugins, source control, and testing tools in order to improve your productivity.
title: Assembling an AWS CloudFormation Authoring Tool Chain

abstract: In this session, we discuss how customers in regulated industries like government, finance, and life sciences can use Amazon WorkSpaces to help meet security and regulatory compliance requirements for user applications and devices. Organizations who have to deal with various regulatory and security requirements (such as HIPAA, PCI, ITAR, and FedRAMP) have to consider how and where their users access applications and store data. In this session, we discuss how Amazon WorkSpaces can help you meet these unique requirements and help provide users throughout your organization with secure, fast access to desktop applications and data.
title: Amazon WorkSpaces for Regulated Industries

abstract: Delivering truly personal responses to customers is one of the most engaging features of an Alexa skill. In this session, learn the different approaches and best practices in creating responses that are tailored to each one of your customers. By applying what you learn, you can keep them coming back to your voice experience.
title: Tailor Your Alexa Skill Responses to Deliver Truly Personal Experiences

abstract: Sophisticated AI capabilities can help us manage the exploding number of information sources and tools required to perform our daily tasks. In this chalk talk, we describe how intelligent agents can be designed to quickly and efficiently complete tasks delegated by users. To build this intelligent agent, we combine a number of AWS services, such as Amazon Polly, Amazon Lex, Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Sumerian, and Amazon ElastiCache along with other technologies, such as CLIPS and Reinforcement Learning. Come hear us discuss the project’s architecture, implementation, and demo progress made to date.
title: Build an Intelligent Multi-Modal User Agent with Voice and NLU

abstract: In this session, learn how an AWS HPC customer in the aerospace engineering segment migrated key parts of their computer-aided engineering (CAE) simulation and visualization applications to AWS to improve infrastructure redundancy for a robust process and user experience, achieving a system speed-up of 18X.
title: Use HPC on AWS for Physics-Based Simulation, ML, and Statistics in CAE

abstract: While the cloud brings lots a world of new capabilities for data and application resilience, our always-on businesses still require a disaster recovery (DR) plan for cloud-based workloads. In this session, we discuss AWS solutions for ensuring business continuity and DR in both active-active and active-passive scenarios.
title: Deep Dive on Disaster Recovery IN the Cloud

abstract: In this talk, we dive into the key metrics and tooling that you should be using to monitor your Kubernetes containerized applications. We dissect the metrics that have shown to be critical for Kubernetes cluster operations. We also share experience gained while helping to build and operate Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS). Topics covered include monitoring etcd and the Kubernetes control plane components.
title: Monitor the World: Meaningful Metrics for Containerized Apps and Clusters

abstract: In this session, we describe when and how to engage users in real time, based on external events and user behaviors, to drive contextual and relevant user interactions. The intended audience is developers who support marketing activities using AWS services. We cover Amazon Pinpoint and Amazon Kinesis in this session.
title: Engage Users in Real-Time through Event-Based Messaging

abstract: In this interactive chalk talk, join the technical leaders of Dow Jones and learn how their migration to Amazon CloudFront was a key inflection point in their ability to improve application performance, functionality, and make their developers’ lives easier. The team shares lessons learned and best practices developed in managing site deployments, A/B testing, moving application logic to the edge, improving security posture, and automating developer workloads across a number of sites and applications while improving reusability and consistency. Topics include Cloudfront, Lambda@Edge, perimeter protection, AWS Certificate Manger (ACM), and other core AWS components. Come ready to engage, since we focus significant time on answering technical questions from the audience.
title: How Dow Jones Uses AWS to Enable Innovation and New Engineering Work

abstract: Git serves repositories well under nominal loads when implemented on reference architectures with appropriate settings. But when request volume increases to hundreds of thousands per day across thousands of hosts, thinking outside the reference architecture box can yield an amazingly scalable and high throughput system. In this chalk talk, we discuss Airbnb's journey, scaling their read-only Git mirror by 4X while reducing cost and operational load with Amazon EFS and Amazon SQS. We describe Airbnb's CI/CD usage patterns, the bottlenecks that grew from them, and how Amazon EFS and Amazon SQS were used to scale past them. Learn from Airbnb's experiences scaling their source-control infrastructure. Bring your questions, discuss your implementation, and expect a deep discussion about optimizing Git workflows.
title: Scale CI/CD & Configuration Management Pipelines with Git, Amazon EFS, & SQS

abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss why using temporary security credentials to manage access to your AWS resources is an AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM) best practice. IAM roles help you follow this best practice by delivering and rotating temporary credentials automatically. We discuss the different types of IAM roles, the assume role functionality, and how to author fine-grained trust and access policies that limit the scope of IAM roles. We then show you how to attach IAM roles to your AWS resources, such as Amazon EC2 instances and AWS Lambda functions. We also discuss migrating applications that use long-term AWS access keys to temporary credentials managed by IAM roles.
title: Unleash the Power of Temporary AWS Credentials (a.k.a. IAM roles)

abstract: Media and entertainment companies are leveraging the on-demand, pay-as-you-go benefits of AWS to cost-effectively create movies, stream videos, broadcast programs, publish content around the world, and store and preserve their media at scale. In this chalk talk, we diagram common reference architectures deployed by some of the top media and entertainment companies that use Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier for active and long-term media archives, and we share best practices for media asset management (MAM), supply chain, and content distribution. We also discuss ways to optimize TCO.
title: Cloud-Based Media Archival, Media Asset Management, & Supply Chain Workflows

abstract: Bring all your questions about AWS Direct Connect, VPN, and any other remote access solutions for us to dive into. Topics can include public VIFs, Direct Connect gateway, transit solutions, overlays—anything goes!
title: Architecting Remote Connectivity

abstract: Key techniques and practices while using Amazon EBS can help push performance and optimize spend. In this session, learn how to optimize storage performance and costs for Amazon EBS using tools such as Amazon CloudWatch, AWS Trusted Advisor, and third-party tools such as Cloudability.
title: Optimizing Amazon EBS for Performance

abstract: Learn how to connect your JMS-based applications to the cloud and integrate them with new cloud-native applications. In this session, we quickly refresh your knowledge about messaging enterprise integration patterns. We then discuss architectural examples to bridge the JMS-based and cloud-native worlds. We work through an example implementation based on Amazon MQ, Amazon SQS, and Amazon SNS. Leave this session with a solid understanding of how to connect existing applications to new cloud-native applications using messaging patterns.
title: Bridging Message Brokers to Cloud-Native Messaging Services

abstract: To help you improve performance and decrease operating costs for your Amazon Redshift cluster, Amazon Redshift Advisor offers specific recommendations about changes to make. In this chalk talk, we explain how the Advisor feature collects and process workload information and more importantly, what customers can do to resolve each existing alert generated by the system.
title: Redshift Advisor Quick Start: Recommendations on Tuning Your Data Warehouse

abstract: In many cases, what separates good models from great ones is the choice of hyperparameters. For example, what is the number of layers you should use; what should be the learning rate; what should be regularization parameters, and so on. In this session, learn how Amazon SageMaker makes discovering the best set of hyperparameters an informed process during training.
title: Automatic Model Tuning Using Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this session, we discuss our learnings from migrating the financial ledger and accounting system that Amazon uses from Oracle to AWS. We share the performance and cost benefits to enterprises who migrate critical systems from Oracle to AWS, the decision frameworks used to pick the appropriate AWS service for appropriate application, and best practices in project management.
title: Migrating Financial and Accounting Systems from Oracle to Amazon DynamoDB

abstract: In this chalk talk, we discuss accelerating your engineering workflows by running your 3D design and engineering apps on Amazon AppStream 2.0. AppStream 2.0 is a fully managed application streaming service that integrates with your pre- and post-engineering workflows, cloud simulations, and IT solutions. We walk through common architectural concepts, reference architecture, as well as user management, networking, storage, and scaling.
title: Learn How You Can Accelerate Engineering Workloads with AppStream 2.0

abstract: Implementing computer vision (CV) models just got simpler and faster. In this chalk talk, learn how to implement CV models using MXNet and the Gluon CV Toolkit, which provides implementations of state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms in computer vision to help engineers, researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas, and learn computer vision.
title: Building State-of-the-Art Computer Vision Models Using MXNet and Gluon

abstract: Internet of Things (IoT) is taking the world by storm. Nearly every study indicates that the number of edge devices connected to an IoT platform will grow exponentially in the next few years. It’s our belief that over time, everything that can be connected to Internet will be. That’s “lots” of things. Protecting your IoT deployment is key to securing data and earning customer trust. In this talk, we walk through best practices for securing edge devices using native capabilities within AWS IoT and AWS IoT Device Defender.
title: Securing and Managing IoT Devices at Scale

abstract: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling now makes it easier than ever to provision and automatically scale instances across purchase options, and instance types in a single Auto Scaling group (ASG), to optimize scale, performance, and cost. Now you can include Spot Instances with On-Demand and RIs in a single ASG, to save up to 90% on compute. In this chalk talk, we will show you how to set up these Auto Scaling groups and discuss the different combinations you can configure that best suit your use case for lowering cost and improving availability.
title: Save up to 90% Using Multiple Purchase Options in Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling

abstract: At Mist, we believe the best way of achieving reliability is by embracing uncontrolled unreliability. We run our microservices and stream processing entirely on Amazon EC2 Spot Instances, which introduces uncontrolled chaos. In this session, we start with an overview of our system and discuss how we achieve high reliability on our largest service, Live Aggregators (LA). LA is our in-house, real-time, timeseries aggregation system that processes over a billion messages a day while aggregating over 100 million timeseries. We also share how we are autoscaling LA by predicting and adapting to changing loads that results in server utilizations of over 70%.
title: Cost-Effectively Running Distributed Systems at Scale in the Cloud

abstract: In this session, learn how an AWS HPC customer in the life sciences domain runs some of their largest HPC workloads and machine learning (ML)-based workloads on AWS. Learn how the customer is using AWS technologies to build their imaging processing cluster and how they identify critical features that would never have been possible with on-premises infrastructure.
title: Analyze Slide Images and Process Phenotypic Assays at Scale on AWS

abstract: The information superhighway is huge, complex, and often congested with traffic, especially to the cloud. Frustrated end users experience latency due to BGP and IP congestion, even on private networks like AWS Direct Connect. In this chalk talk, Verizon and AWS offer a tutorial on how best to design an optimal network, even for FedRAMP, IL 4-5, CJIS, and HIPAA compliance. Come armed with questions, and learn how this team created a successful network architecture optimized for cloud.
title: HOT Lanes to the AWS Cloud: Optimize Network Design for AWS GovCloud (US)

abstract: In this chalk talk, we explain how to put together a serverless "content-aware clipping" video workflow, and we identify technology choice tradeoffs using Amazon Rekognition for celebrity identification as the backdrop.
title: Build Your Own Royal Wedding Celebrity Viewing Experience

abstract: Machine learning is no longer limited to offline use cases. Most companies across sectors like transportation, social media, automobile, manufacturing, and healthcare want to use machine learning models in real time. To do this, customers need to use machine learning models in conjunction with their microservices architectures. In most such environments, high throughput and low latency are paramount. AWS makes it easy for customers to deploy machine learning models in such demanding scenarios. In this session, we review the various patterns that have emerged in this regard. First, we review how Amazon SageMaker enables low latency real-time inferencing. We review the multiple considerations needed to achieve a satisfactory performance. There are some scenarios even in micro-services environments that are suited for batch inferencing. We review how Amazon SageMaker enables large scale batch inferencing. We then review how to make these batch inferences available in low-latency environments by using in-memory stores. We discuss practical tips and tricks and provide demos that show these techniques in action.
title: AI/ML-Powered Microservices

abstract: Records management is a requirement in almost every industry. Whether it is one, thirty, or a hundred years, it requires a disciplined process to ensure accuracy and compliance Now that you have your data moved into AWS, how do you ensure that it isn’t removed by mistake? How do you know when your data has transitioned into an archive state? In this session, we explore the challenges of records management in data lakes and how to address them within your organization. Learn how to automate the process for compliance and audit using a solution of combined AWS services, including AWS Step Functions, AWS Lambda, Amazon DynamoDB, and AWS CloudTrail. Hear from an AWS customer who solved this challenge for their highly regulated industry.
title: Implement Enterprise Records Management Policies on Your AWS Data Lake

abstract: Most of you can scale your applications on Amazon EC2 without needing any capacity reservations. For those of you who are risk averse and need the additional confidence, we now have Amazon EC2 Capacity Reservations. A Capacity Reservation enables you to reserve Amazon EC2 capacity for any duration without having to commit to a 1- or 3-year term, unlike RIs. In this session, we share the key features and benefits for using Capacity Reservations, and we explain how Capacity Reservations can help you manage capacity flexibly and independently of your financial commitments (RI discounts). We describe different use cases for Capacity Reservations, and we explore how they work with Regional RIs to get you the best of both worlds.
title: Reserve Amazon EC2 On-Demand Capacity for Any Duration with On-Demand Capacity Reservations

abstract: As a leader in agriculture technologies and services, Bayer is using technologies such as unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV), satellite imagery, and sensor data from multiple sources to generate real time insights. Over 300 data sources are ingested into their open source HPC geospatial platform to generate on average 100M API calls per day. The platform is used to provide real-time visualization and computational analysis to Bayer’s internal research community, partners, and is licensed to third-party applications to provide insights relevant to high-yield production of crops. In this session, Mendez-Costabel discusses how Bayer transitioned from on-premises packaged software architecture to open-source software and cloud services from AWS to build a modern, scalable, high-performance, open-source app on AWS. Learn about the open-source application architecture and AWS services used. Learn how the computing environment has changed the way that Bayer is performing R&D projects, and how the move to a modern architecture has enabled Bayer’s customers to gain insights that are transforming their businesses.
title: Build a High-Performance, Cloud-Native, Open-Source Platform on AWS & Save Millions

abstract: In healthcare, pharmacovigilance is key to improving patient outcomes. The prediction of adverse events will enable pharmaceutical companies and drug distributors in accurately meeting their pharmacovigilance requirements and scaling their operations. In this chalk talk, we discuss how Amazon SageMaker can be used to classify large-scale agent and reporter interaction summaries. We also discuss natural language processing (NLP) methods and results.
title: NLP in Healthcare to Predict Adverse Events with Amazon SageMaker

abstract: Companies often have engineers dedicated to managing their Jenkins build environments, but developers often spend their time maintaining the underlying infrastructure instead of writing code. There are a number of plugins in the Jenkins ecosystem that can help reduce the overhead of your build farms. Unfortunately, these options often introduce additional complexity because they rely on other computing orchestration platforms, such as Swarm, Mesos, or even the Amazon ECS container platform. There has to be a simpler way. In this session, we show you how to integrate AWS CodeBuild with Jenkins to remove the overhead in creating, managing, and scaling your build farms.
title: Remove Undifferentiated Heavy Lifting from Jenkins

abstract: VMware Cloud on AWS helps customers run VMware environments on the AWS Cloud, enabling them to utilize the power of VMware NSX network virtualization features on top of AWS networking. In this chalk talk, we discuss the network connectivity options available for connecting into your VMware Cloud on AWS SDDC clusters using AWS Direct Connect and VPNs.
title: Networking for VMware Cloud on AWS

abstract: Phil and Ajit facilitated many large and small digital transformations. Through those digital and technological transformations, they helped businesses transform. They looked around to learn from others, made a playbook to follow, and made mistakes along the way that others can learn from. In this session, they discuss the top five do’s and don’t's from their digital transformation playbook.
title: Digital Transformation Playbook in Five Steps

abstract: A critical component of any cloud journey is ensuring that the identity architecture enables users and operators of cloud-based infrastructure to maintain or increase their level of productivity while maintaining appropriate levels of security. Such an architecture must take into account the likelihood that engineers from different organizations and differing operating models must work together to achieve outcomes. This talk explores how AWS Managed Services built such a system, leveraging industry standard components. Security experts from across multiple AWS service teams answer your questions about strategy and technical implementation.
title: Architecting for Enterprise Identity Across Multiple Operating Models

abstract: Learn best practices from Hilton Hotels Worldwide as they built an Enterprise Data Lake/Management (EDM) platform on AWS to drive insights and analytics for their business applications, including worldwide hotel booking and reservation management systems. The EDM architecture is built with Hadoop clusters running on Amazon EC2 combined with Amazon Redshift and Amazon Athena for data warehousing and ad hoc SQL analytics. This is a great opportunity to get an unfiltered customer perspective on their road to data nirvana!
title: Ask an Amazon Redshift Customer Anything

abstract: In this lab, you will use Amazon SageMaker to train a machine learning model and utilize the model to enrich the response that Alexa provides back to the user.
title: Building Alexa Skills with Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this lab, you will create a simple FAQ microservice. The microservice will return a JSON object containing a random question-and-answer pair using an API Gateway endpoint that invokes a Lambda function.
title: Introduction to Amazon API Gateway

abstract: In this lab, you will learn how to take a pre-created application, package it as a Docker image, and deploy the container in Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) using AWS CloudFormation.
title: Building and Deploying Containers Using Amazon ECS

abstract: In this lab, you learn how to train your model to make predictions using any of Amazon SageMaker's built-in algorithms and frameworks.
title: Creating and Tuning Models with Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this lab, you will utilize the AWS Elemental MediaConvert service to convert input video into multiple output formats, combine multiple videos into one during the conversion process, add captions or watermarks to the videos, and work with ad insertion metadata.
title: Video on Demand with AWS Elemental MediaConvert

abstract: In this lab, you build a complete serverless application that demonstrates how to convert text-to-speech using Amazon Polly.
title: Build a Serverless Text-To-Speech Application with Amazon Polly

abstract: In this lab, you learn how to deploy a simple web application continuously using the Elastic Beanstalk Command Line Interface (EB CLI) in two ways: rolling deployment and blue/green deployment.
title: Blue/Green Deployment Pattern with AWS Elastic Beanstalk

abstract: In this lab, you learn how to use Amazon CloudWatch Events with an AWS Lambda function to detect changes to the ingress permissions of an Amazon EC2 security group.
title: Monitoring Security Groups with Amazon CloudWatch Events

abstract: In this session, we guide first-time users through the process of setting up an HPC cluster on AWS, and provide a quick start guide to setting up the right environment for different types of HPC workloads.
title: Setting up Your First HPC Cluster on AWS

abstract: Are you ready to move past static email reports, Excel spreadsheets, and one-time queries? In this builders session, learn how to build a rich and interactive business dashboard in Amazon QuickSight that allows your business stakeholders to filter, slice and dice, and deep-dive on their own. We demonstrate advanced Amazon QuickSight capabilities such as creating on-sheet filter controls, parameters, custom URLs, and table calculations to create rich and attractive executive dashboards.
title: Building Rich and Interactive Business Dashboards in Amazon QuickSight

abstract: In this session, you learn how to use Amazon GuardDuty to implement automated controls for PCI DSS requirement 12.9 in your PCI-controlled Amazon EC2 environment. The PCI DSS requirement 12.9 says: Implement an incident response plan. Be prepared to respond immediately to a system breach. In this session, we simulate an instance compromise scenario that triggers a series of automated steps to isolate the instance, notify SecOps, and capture a forensics snapshot.
title: Security Incident Automation for PCI DSS Compliance

abstract: In this session, we focus on building an OLAP application that is fit for use in financial institutions and that is entirely serverless. The application uses AWS Glue for extract, transform, and load operations, Amazon S3 for highly available and durable storage, and Amazon Athena to query the data. The solution also uses Amazon QuickSight to provide dashboards and reports. At the end of this session, participants should have a fully functioning OLAP application that they can apply to multiple use cases in financial services.
title: Build a Serverless Online Analytical Processing App for Financial Services

abstract: In this builder session, we cover the basics of setting up a remote visualization session for HPC workloads.
title: Using NICE DCV to Visualize your HPC Simulations

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to get started with the VMware on AWS solution for your healthcare organization. Ask questions of a Senior Solutions Architect who is working in the healthcare industry.
title: VMware on AWS for Healthcare

abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise with AWS IoT Core. You begin by leveraging the AWS IoT Device SDKs to securely connect to AWS IoT, then you modify and send sample data over MQTT to AWS IoT Core. Lastly, you learn how to make that data actionable by leveraging the AWS IoT rules engine. By the end of the session, expect to have a solid understanding of how AWS IoT works and how to begin using AWS IoT in your applications.
title: Build an End-To-End IoT Example with AWS IoT Core

abstract: In this session, learn how to create an HR data lake on AWS to develop a more wholistic view of people data to enable secure, self-service reporting for HR business partners and managers, and to use more advanced data science tools to unlock new insights to reduce retention, enhance hiring practices, and improve employee productivity. We provide examples of HR insights and the business value they can drive, walk through a reference architecture example for an HR data lake, and outline key steps and best practices as you design and launch your HR data lake project. AWS services addressed in this session include AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, AWS Glue, and Amazon Athena.
title: How to Build HR Lakes on AWS to Unlock New Business Insights

abstract: In this session, we guide participants through the process of setting up a Slurm head node that is managing an on-premises compute cluster to support bursting to AWS.
title: Deploying a Burstable and Event-Driven HPC Cluster on AWS

abstract: Streaming data ingestion and near real-time analysis give you immediate insights into your data. By using AWS Lambda with Amazon Kinesis, you can obtain these insights without the need to manage servers. In this builders session, we discuss how you can use Lambda and Kinesis together to build an end-to-end serverless solution.
title: Serverless Stream Processing with AWS Lambda

abstract: Amazon EMR was built for agility, enabling you to spin up and down resources for big data processing and analytics on demand, and realize the flexible potential of cloud. In this builders session, we detail how to efficiently start, stop, and resize your clusters for Apache Spark and Hadoop, reducing your costs, and accelerating your "time-to-completion" for jobs. Join us to hear expert advice on how to optimize your "one and done" workloads.
title: Amazon EMR: Optimize Transient Clusters for Data Processing and ETL

abstract: There are many different ways to get your file-based data into Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS, from AWS command line tools, to scripts using open source tools, to proprietary commercial tools built for media workflows. Start using best practices to improve data transfer performance, including scaling out parallel streams and automating workflows. Get hands on with your environment in this session with guidance from an AWS expert.
title: Get Your Data into Amazon S3 & Amazon EFS Fast â Starting Today

abstract: In this session, we show an end-to-end sample machine learning (ML) workflow on AWS with a sample analysis using a call detail record (CDR) data set. The model does not solve all customer problems, but provides a data science framework that can be adjusted to the customer's specific data set and analytic goals. We focus on a sample CDR data set, leveraging Jupyter Notebooks to support three main functions: ad-hoc data exploration and visualization using AWS Glue to transform raw data into Parquet format, using Amazon Athena to perform three sample data sampling analyses; data preparation and feature engineering, splitting data into test/training sets and developing data features (Jupyter Notebook); and model training and evaluation using logistic regression with Spark MLlib and evaluative tests (Jupyter Notebook).
title: Machine Learning in Telco: Analysis of Call Detail Record Data Sets

abstract: In this session, get hands on with Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier, an extremely low-cost storage class in S3 for data archiving and long-term backup.  Learn best practices for reducing storage costs, ensuring data lifecycle management, and balancing retrieval times and cost through the various restore tiers and SLAs.
title: Performance & Cost Optimization at Scale with Amazon S3 & Amazon Glacier

abstract: In this session, we guide participants on setting up their HPC environment to run weather research and forecasting (WRF) application on AWS. We provide tips and tricks to optimize the weather modeling application.
title: Weather Modeling with WRF on AWS

abstract: Amazon SageMaker makes it easy to use Jupyter Notebooks. In this session, learn how to connect Jupyter Notebooks to your Amazon Neptune instance. You also have the opportunity to build graph queries to leverage graph data.
title: Getting Started with Amazon Neptune and Amazon SageMaker Jupyter Notebooks

abstract: In this session, you build a custom, self-service catalog of third-party products from AWS Marketplace for your teams. Then, using AWS Service Catalog, we show you how to distribute that catalog of products to authorized users across multiple AWS regions and accounts within your organization. You learn how to enforce tagging, maintain your corporate security posture, and enable budget controls.
title: Distributing and Securing Third-Party Software Products Across AWS

abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builder's session, we discuss how to work with data residing in relational databases such as Amazon Aurora, Amazon Redshift, and PostgreSQL. Learn how to set up your network so that your AWS Glue job can access data residing in your virtual private cloud (VPC), tune queries so that they can effectively utilize parallel connections, and work with job bookmarks to load only new data into your data lake.
title: Working with Relational Databases in AWS Glue ETL

abstract: You've got SFTP. It's probably attached to that application you need to move to AWS. Or, you want to move your SFTP server to AWS so you can store the files you're exchanging in Amazon S3. In this session, sit down with an AWS expert and get hands on with setting up your own SFTP services in AWS. We use best practices and automation tricks to help streamline movement of your SFTP workflows into AWS without redoing your authentication schemes.
title: Start Shifting SFTP Workflows to the Cloud Now

abstract: In this session, we discuss the factors you should consider in selecting the right storage solution for your HPC workload.
title: Selecting the Right Storage for Your HPC Workload

abstract: In this session, we dive deep into accelerating your migration to AWS by finding matching products from your existing inventory of on-premises applications with AWS Marketplace Migration Mapping Assistant. We show you how to import a list of your current software applications to AWS, and run a bulk search to find corresponding third-party products that are available to purchase and deploy from AWS Marketplace.
title: Accelerate Your Migration with AWS Marketplace Migration Mapping Assistant

abstract: In this session, learn how to build a data science environment based on Amazon EMR that can process highly sensitive data in a secure manner. We explain how to secure the OS, perform logging, auditing, and use encryption to meet stringent NIST 800-53 security standards. In addition, we walk through and demonstrate the build of an EMR cluster intended to process highly sensitive data. Attendees see the cluster being built and observe how various AWS services further secure the cluster. Attendees also see an AWS CloudFormation script that ultimately automates the process. In addition, we demonstrate how to lock down the OS and enable logging and auditing to further protect the data and system. Finally, we walk through which NIST 800-53 controls are satisfied in this cluster configuration and how you can build this yourself.
title: Build an Amazon EMR-Based Data Science Environment for Highly Sensitive Data

abstract: Build out operational intelligence from your existing data sources including historian data. In this session, learn how to build an OSI PI Integrator to access and migrate data from OSI on premises to an AWS instance to build additional levels of operational intelligence, including AI/ML capabilities in quick and easy steps. We use the published OSI Integrator and DataRPM Quick Start to build predictive capabilities.
title: Industrial Intelligence: Generate Insights from Historian Data

abstract: In this session, we discuss best practices for running high performance computing (HPC) workloads on AWS, including considerations for selecting the right Amazon EC2 instance based on your workload type.
title: Running High Performance Computing Workloads in the Cloud

abstract: VPC Sharing is a new approach to network management on AWS, where a single VPC can be centrally managed and shared with other AWS accounts as part of AWS Organizations. This model enables customers to leverage the benefits of using multiple AWS accounts without the complexities of managing a partitioned network with a high number of VPCs. In this session, we create a VPC and associated resources, share it with members of AWS Organizations, and learn about the security and operation aspects of managing VPC Sharing. Laptops are required.
title: A New Multi-Account Approach to VPC Management

abstract: Amazon EFS provides simple, scalable, elastic file storage for Amazon EC2 instances and on-premises resources. It is built to elastically scale on demand and provides parallel shared access to thousands of Amazon EC2 instances with consistent low latencies. In this session, we review the tools you can use to analyze the performance of workloads running on Amazon EFS. After an overview of client-side and AWS tooling, we go hands-on and analyze the performance of a few real-world applications.
title: Analyze Amazon EFS Application Performance

abstract: One of the biggest tradeoffs customers make when deploying BI solutions at scale is agility versus governance. Large-scale business intelligence (BI) implementations with the right governance structure can take months to design and deploy. In this session, learn how to avoid making this tradeoff using Amazon QuickSight. Learn how to easily deploy Amazon QuickSight to thousands of users using Active Directory and federated SSO, while securely accessing your data sources in Amazon VPCs or on premises. We also cover how to control access to datasets, implement row-level security, create scheduled email reports, and audit access to your data.
title: Deploy Business Analytics at Enterprise Scale with Amazon QuickSight

abstract: In the financial services industry, it is common for databases to contain sensitive data, which can make migrating them to the public cloud a concern. In this session, we share best practices on securely migrating Oracle databases to Amazon Aurora MySQL and PostgreSQL using the AWS Database Migration Service and the AWS Schema Conversion Tool. We also explore using AWS Key Management Service to encrypt data during and after the migration.
title: How Financial Institutions Can Securely Migrate Commercial Databases to Aurora

abstract: In this session, we show how to build a live channel and a file-based video on-demand (VOD) workflow quickly and easily by using AWS VOD and live video streaming solutions. Learn how to get broadcast-quality video using a well-architected, highly available workflow and how to customize, enhance, and continually improve your offerings from there. After a brief introduction on how to add advanced services such as machine learning (ML) to optimize the viewing experience, we discuss use cases and lessons learned from companies that built these workflows.
title: Build OTT Workflows for VOD and Live Video Streaming on AWS

abstract: If you are new to Spot Instances and would like to take advantage of the cost savings, test/dev is a great place to start. Load, integration, canary, and security testing benefit from the elasticity and price savings associated with Spot Instances. In this session, learn how to run an enterprise test/dev workload on Amazon EC2 Spot Instances. Also learn how to use the Fleet API to diversify and use different instance pools. Finally, learn some tips and tricks for minimizing the impact of interruptions.
title: Running Enterprise Test/Dev on Amazon EC2 Spot Instances

abstract: In this builders session, we cover the fundamentals of performance tuning for OLTP query workloads against Amazon Neptune. Using AWS CloudFormation scripts, participants have the opportunity to set up a Neptune and Jupyter Notebook stack, enabling them to run small read and write query workloads against Neptune in their own AWS account. After a short discussion of Neptune’s architecture, we tune the scripts to maximize the throughput of the sample workloads through client-side parameter tuning and server-side improvements, such as failover to larger instance types and provisioning additional read replicas. Throughout the session, we discuss how to use Amazon CloudWatch metrics to understand system behavior and identify optimization potential.
title: Neptune Performance Tuning: Get the Best out of Amazon Neptune

abstract: This is an advanced hands-on session where you create a fleet of reverse proxy instances that will do URL filtering. Expect to learn about AWS PrivateLink, proxies, and cross-VPC connectivity. Bring your laptops.
title: Use AWS PrivateLink to Create a URL-Filtering Reverse Proxy Fleet

abstract: VPC Sharing is a new approach to network management on AWS, where a single VPC can be centrally managed and shared with other AWS accounts as part of AWS Organizations. This model enables customers to leverage the benefits of using multiple AWS accounts without the complexities of managing a partitioned network with a high number of VPCs. In this session, we create a VPC and associated resources, share it with members of AWS Organizations, and learn about the security and operation aspects of managing VPC Sharing. Laptops are required.
title: A New Multi-Account Approach to VPC Management

abstract: Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed platform that enables developers and data scientists to quickly and easily build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models at any scale. Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. In this builders session, we walk through how the two services can be used in conjunction to perform real-time ML at any scale.
title: Real-Time Machine Learning Using Amazon Kinesis and Amazon SageMaker

abstract: In this builders session, learn how AWS Step Functions and AWS Batch can be used to quickly build pipelines for the analysis of life sciences data. Ask questions of a Senior Solutions Architect who is working in the life sciences and genomics industry.
title: Simplified Data Pipelining for Life Sciences

abstract: Amazon Mechanical Turk (Mechanical Turk) aims to make accessing human intelligence simple, scalable, and cost-effective. The diversification and the scale of the Mechanical Turk workforce enables you to collect a breadth of information that would be almost impossible to do otherwise. Learn how Mechanical Turk can make it easy to gather the information you need online.
title: Gathering Data with Amazon Mechanical Turk

abstract: In this session, get hands on with Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier, an extremely low-cost storage class in S3 for data archiving and long-term backup.  Understand how to use object versioning to preserve full data history. Learn best practices for configuring and managing object policies, including storage buckets, security, regulatory compliance, data replication and business continuity.
title: Configuration and Management Best Practices with Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier

abstract: Amazon EMR helps you process all your data for analytics, but with great scale comes great responsibility—you need to make sure that data is secured by design. In this builders session, we walk through how to configure your environment to take full advantage of comprehensive security controls: including identifying sensitive data, encrypting your data and managing keys, authenticating and authorizing users, utilizing fine-grained access controls, and using audit logs to demonstrate compliance.
title: Lock It Down: Configure End-to-End Security & Access Control on Amazon EMR

abstract: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed Redis and Memcached, which you can use to seamlessly deploy, run, and scale popular open-source compatible in-memory data stores. Come to this session to learn how to build data-intensive apps or improve the performance of your existing apps by retrieving data from high throughput and low latency in-memory data stores.
title: Build High-Performance Apps with Amazon ElastiCache

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to create serverless functions with AWS Lambda, call them with Amazon API Gateway, and how to enable interoperability interfaces for healthcare messaging applications. Ask questions to a Senior Solutions Architect who is working in the healthcare industry.
title: Creating Serverless Functions for Healthcare Messaging Applications

abstract: Permission boundaries is probably one of the most important new IAM feature in awhile. This feature addresses a longstanding customer issue, namely, how do I delegate administration to my users. If you have developers that need to be able to create role for Lambda functions, system admins that need to be able to create IAM roles and users, or any similar scenario, then you need permission boundaries.
title: Permission Boundaries: How to Truly Delegate Permissions on AWS

abstract: Collecting events at web scale can be daunting, frustrating, and a distraction from building technology that adds value to your company's core offerings for your customers.
