In this session, learn how to design and deploy serverless pipelines for collecting events at web scale, such as advertising pixels, site visits, site interaction, and e-commerce. We work together to build a serverless collection pipeline utilizing Amazon Route 53, Amazon CloudFront, AWS Lambda@Edge, Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, Elasticsearch, Amazon S3, AWS Glue, and Amazon Redshift. At the end of this session, you will understand ways you can deploy a serverless pipeline in your architectures.
title: Create a Serverless Web Event Pipeline

abstract: In this session, learn how to achieve high-quality output from crowdsourcing through well-designed and clearly explained tasks, and verify your crowdsourced data.
title: Design Tasks for Quality Results from the Crowd Using Amazon Mechanical Turk

abstract: Imagine being able to transcribe calls, translate them into multiple languages and then being able to identify key topics discussed in those calls. All of that is possible today with machine learning services offered by AWS. In AWS, you can easily integrate your real-time communication infrastructure with state-of-the-art AI services to enhance user experience. In this workshop, learn how to set up a secure and highly available WebRTC system on AWS and then integrate it with AWS AI services to provide services such as transcription (Amazon Transcribe), translation (Amazon Translate), and meta-data creation (Amazon Comprehend).
title: Set Up a Communications Platform on AWS with AI-Enhanced Services

abstract: You're just getting started on your cloud journey. Perhaps you've deployed a simple application on AWS, but you're curious about how you can manage more complex workloads. In this session, we walk through some considerations to keep in mind when deploying multi-tier applications. We can even migrate one of your applications, or you can try it out on one of our demo apps.
title: Deploy and Scale a Multi-Tier Application with Amazon Lightsail

abstract: With the approaching end of support for Microsoft SQL Server 2008, it is important to understand your options for upgrading the database layer of your existing applications. The fully managed Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for SQL Server makes it easy to upgrade, set up, operate, and scale your SQL Server business applications for high availability. Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to migrate a SQL Server database to Amazon RDS.
title: Migrate Your First SQL Server Database to Amazon RDS for SQL Server

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a domain trust between on-premises Active Directory and AWS Managed AD in AWS. As a bonus, learn how to connect AWS Managed AD to AWS SSO.
title: Active Directory Domain Trusts and AWS SSO Jumpstart

abstract: Learn how to build a real-time Kabana Contact Center dashboard leveraging services such as Amazon Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Amazon Athena, and ASW Glue. You will have a real-time view of your contact centre data to gain insights into areas such as the customer journey, KPI's, and monitoring your contact centre experience. We will also show how you can use other AI services such as Amazon Comprehend and Amazon Transcribe to get additional sentiment data about your agents and customers.
title: Build a Real-Time Kibana Dashboard for Your Contact Center Data

abstract: This is a hands-on and explorative session on what network engineers need to know about VPC mechanics and networking. We include hands-on exercises to demonstrate some differences in networking as well as the things that network engineers should know about AWS. Bring your laptops.
title: AWS Networking for Network Engineers

abstract: Are you planning to move your data centers to AWS? In this session, we whiteboard how to build an accurate migration cost model and use AWS Application Discovery Service to obtain the information necessary to quickly build the model by incorporating Amazon EC2 pricing, target instance and storage sizes, network cost, and migration labor costs.
title: Build a Migration Portfolio Assessment & Compare AWS & On-Premises Costs

abstract: Amazon S3 is the leading cloud storage provider, and it has helped customers of all sizes and industries meet their storage needs in today’s complicated data landscape. While Amazon S3 supports many automated features to help save on storage time and costs, there are some pitfalls that customers can avoid to maximize their resources and optimize performance. In this builders session, Amazon S3 experts provide hands-on guidance on optimizing throughputs for large Amazon S3 objects, request rates for small Amazon S3 objects, and data transfers to Amazon S3 over long distances. All attendees should have an AWS account and be able to perform basic Linux commands.
title: Optimizing Amazon S3 Data Throughputs, Requests, and Transfers

abstract: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. In this builders session, we walk through a common use case for Amazon Kinesis Data Streams and the top five best practices we see customers implement when processing data in real-time.
title: Best Practices in Streaming Data with Amazon Kinesis

abstract: Building a meeting experience and robust chat is difficult. With Amazon Chime, we have taken care of that for you by providing a unified communication solution that includes meetings, chat, and flexible pay-as-you go pricing all built on the AWS Cloud. We also understand how important it is for your collaboration application to work well with your existing tools. Join us in this session as we deep dive into how the Amazon Chime administrator and client APIs can be used to integrate Amazon Chime into your organization, enabling smoother workflows and better collaboration, while maintaining your security standards.
title: Build Amazon Chime into Your Teamâs Workflow with Amazon Chime Administrator & Client APIs

abstract: In this session, we introduce one of the most engaging features of the Amazon Sumerian service: Sumerian Hosts. Hosts are animated, interactive digital avatars that can be integrated into your 3D and augmented reality (AR) applications. Currently, there are four Hosts available: Cristine, Preston, Grace and Luke. In this builders session, we walk through the capabilities of Sumerian Hosts and demonstrate how to create custom speeches. After this builders session, you will be able to start creating dynamic scenes that include Hosts.
title: Meet Cristine, Luke, Grace and Preston: Introduction to Sumerian Hosts (Virtual Avatars)

abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the MySQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Serverless or Parallel Query.
title: Build on Amazon Aurora with MySQL Compatibility

abstract: If you're moving your Oracle databases to the cloud, Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) provides you with several options. Learn about Amazon RDS for Oracle, discuss the Oracle functionality that it supports, and see how to convert and migrate your database to Amazon Aurora for high performance and availability at one-tenth the cost.
title: Migrate Your Oracle Database to Amazon RDS

abstract: We start from scratch, and in an hour, you will have an Alexa skill working end to end.
title: Build Your First Alexa Skill

abstract: In this session, you work with Echo Show to see how to add visual components to your conversational experiences.
title: Add Screen Support to an Alexa Skill

abstract: In this session, we start with a basic Alexa skill, and then we integrate in-skill purchasing to enable products to be purchased using voice.
title: Add In-Skill Purchasing to an Alexa Skill

abstract: In this session, discover the process of thinking through the design of a voice experience using intents, slots, entity resolution, and dialog management.
title: Designing the Voice User Interface for an Alexa Skill

abstract: Have you ever wondered exactly how to get started with AWS? In this session, come spend time with the Amazon Lightsail team, and move one of your applications to the cloud. We sit down with you and help you deploy a workload on AWS using Lightsail. So bring your own workload, or use one of our demo examples, and get started today.
title: Move Your First Application to the Cloud with Amazon Lightsail

abstract: Software patching is one of the most important defensive security techniques for connected devices, including for IoT. Feature upgrades are also a common business requirement for staying competitive. Amazon FreeRTOS supports over-the-air (OTA) updates using AWS IoT Device Management in the cloud and a portable interface on the device. Come see a demo and learn how to use Amazon FreeRTOS OTA with your product.
title: Learn How to Perform OTA Updates on Amazon FreeRTOS

abstract: In this session, we set up a CI/CD pipeline using Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) and AWS CodePipeline.
title: Set Up a CI/CD Pipeline with Amazon EKS and AWS CodePipeline

abstract: Learn how to create multi-region REST APIs with the Amazon API Gateway with automatic failover. In this builders session, we cover how to create an API, configure a custom domain name, and set up Amazon Route 53 to work with this setup.
title: Multi-Region REST APIs with Automatic Failover

abstract: When building cloud-connected mobile apps, you want to give users an amazing experience while still ensuring security and scalability. In this session, we work through the top ten problems in mobile app development for the cloud, and we discuss how to ensure that you don't make the same mistakes.
title: When Mobile Apps Connect to the Cloud: Top Ten Problems & How to Avoid Them

abstract: Oftentimes, customer systems need to be developed and tested in an environment where they need to interact with an enterprise desktop baseline or with long-standing corporate systems, such as Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, and Microsoft SharePoint. Attend this session to learn how to build and automate a fully functional, in-the-cloud lab environment using Amazon WorkSpaces and Microsoft enterprise applications, like Active Directory, Exchange, and SharePoint, to enable customers to develop and test their applications and services in a temporary lab environment that can be modeled after the production environment. Session Objectives: 1) Learn how to architect an entire desktop and supporting corporate business systems to run in AWS. 2) Learn how to manually deploy the intended architecture using the AWS Management Console. 3) Learn how to use AWS CloudFormation and Windows PowerShell to automate the end-to-end deployment of the environment. 4) Learn how to optimize the entire lab environment to further reduce costs.
title: On-Demand Enterprise IT Environments, from Desktops to Servers

abstract: In this session, use metrics and logs from Amazon CloudFront, and tools such as Amazon CloudWatch and third-party performance measurement tools, to measure and improve your web and mobile performance.
title: Use Monitoring, Logs, and Analytics Tools to Measure CDN and Site Performance

abstract: AWS Systems Manager provides predefined automation documents for common operational tasks that can be customized to meet your specific use cases. In this session, learn how to build new or customize existing automation documents leveraging predefined documents, automation plugins, and environment variables. Use Systems Manager’s built-in rate controls to incrementally and safely roll out changes when stopping, starting, or restarting Amazon EC2 instances, updating Linux and Windows Amazon Machine Images, or updating software on multiple Amazon EC2 instances.
title: Automate Common Maintenance & Deployment Tasks Using AWS Systems Manager

abstract: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a fully managed database service that enables you to launch an optimally configured, secure, and highly available database with just a few clicks and with seven database engines to choose from. Join this session, and discuss the database engine of your choice, learn about recent Amazon RDS features, and find the best way to migrate your existing database.
title: Build on Amazon RDS

abstract: Tools such as AWS CloudTrail, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS Config can be used to track, monitor, analyze, and audit events. In this session, learn how to raise an incident and trigger the incident management process necessary to mitigate the incident.
title: Incident Response in AWS

abstract: In this session, build a pipeline product that your lean teams can use to bring their application code, tests, and infrastructure to be vetted, executed, approved, and eventually published with AWS Service Catalog.
title: Empower Lean Teams with Centrally Governed CI/CD Pipelines Using AWS CodePipeline & AWS Service Catalog

abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon MQ to connect IBM MQ to the AWS cloud. We demonstrate how to set up an Amazon MQ message broker and start sending messages from IBM MQ to Amazon MQ.
title: Use Amazon MQ to Connect On-Premises Messaging to the Cloud

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a .NET CI/CD pipeline with AWS and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services.
title: Build a .NET CI/CD Pipeline with AWS & AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services

abstract: In this session, we help Jenkins users release on AWS quickly and easily. We install AWS CodeBuild to optimize your Jenkins builds and set up automatic deployments with AWS CodeDeploy.
title: Deploy Your Jenkins Pipeline to AWS & Optimize Your Builds

abstract: Tapes. If they're still coming in and out of your data center, and you don't love dealing with them, join our AWS expert to learn how you can set up the AWS Storage Gateway service as a virtual tape library. You get the opportunity to deploy a tape gateway that works with your existing backup applications on-premises. Start your switch to cloud backups today without changing your workflows. Bring a laptop with remote access to your on-premises VM infrastructure, available memory and disk space for cache, and access to your existing backup application.
title: Stop Backing Up to Tape Now

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to automatically remediate security issues using AWS Lambda, Amazon CloudWatch Events, and the AWS Personal Health Dashboard. We build AWS Lambda functions to react to an access key compromise to disable the keys and notify our operations team.
title: Serverless Security Remediation

abstract: Customers are using automatic metadata extraction to fuel new insights and provide innovative services to their customers. In this session, we walk through the basic architecture patterns for implementing automatic metadata extraction using Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend. We also share how to get started with the pre-configured AWS Media Analysis Solution.
title: Automatically Extract Metadata Using Computer Vision & Language AI Services

abstract: In this session, participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a serverless solution across multiple regions using AWS Lambda and Amazon DynamoDB global tables.
title: Building Multi-Region Microservices

abstract: In this working session, bring your live video streaming application. Learn what can be done to help you improve the latency of your video streaming solution.
title: Configure an End-to-End Video Channel to Deliver Low Latency

abstract: Properly implementing security controls is critical to running containers in production. In this session, we cover the basics of container security and explain how to use AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) permissions and VPC networking to enable functionality and restrict unauthorized access.
title: Security for Containers on Amazon ECS

abstract: Whether you're selling millions of IoT devices to customers or deploying thousands to your own factories, protecting your IoT fleet can be difficult. But with AWS, you can quickly deploy, manage, and audit your devices’ security posture consistently and continuously. In this session, we help you deploy a provided AWS IoT 1-click button securely with its own certificate, register the device with a simple function, and then audit the device’s security posture against best practices.
title: Auditing Your IoT Environment at Scale

abstract: Do you want to learn how to achieve multi-region database persistence for your single-page web app backed by a container based backend on AWS? In this session, you will participate in a hands-on exercise where you create, verify, and test a single-page web app and container based backend that uses a relational database solution across multiple AWS regions. This exercise will use the following AWS services: AWS Fargate, Amazon Aurora with MySQL compatibility, Amazon S3, Amazon Route 53, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeDeploy, AWS CodeCommit, Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR), and AWS CloudFormation. Please note that participants will need to have general knowledge of Docker, MySQL, IAM, and some knowledge of ReactJS and Ruby. Participants are also required to have an AWS account before the session in order to run through this exercise.
title: Building Multi-Region Persistence with MySQL

abstract: Understanding the licensing options for Microsoft workloads on AWS is critical in achieving the lowest total cost of ownership (TCO) during a cloud migration. In this interactive session, we focus on best practices for bringing on-premises licenses to AWS, and we discuss how these choices impact TCO. Topics include license mobility, dedicated AWS infrastructure, development and testing, and the recently released Optimize CPU feature.
title: How to Optimize TCO by Bringing Microsoft Licenses to AWS

abstract: In this builder session, cloud architects, desktop managers, and ITSM leads learn how to use the AWS Service Catalog Connector to launch, operate, and manage Amazon WorkSpaces in ServiceNow. You also learn how to enable Amazon WorkSpaces user self-service capabilities, such as reboot and rebuild. You can use the capabilities and learn to build a governance and management framework for your Amazon WorkSpaces environment that incorporates self-service capabilities to reduce your management overhead.
title: Lifecycle Management of Amazon WorkSpaces Using the AWS Service Catalog Connector for ServiceNow

abstract: In this session, learn how to use PyTorch in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.
title: Amazon SageMaker and PyTorch: Tips & Tricks

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to learn how to create and deploy a .NET serverless app on AWS using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.
title: Build a Serverless .NET App on AWS Using the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio

abstract: In this hands-on session, learn how to upgrade your AWS Direct Connect circuit without outages. We include details about failover, BGP settings, and how DX routing operates. Bring your laptop.
title: Upgrade AWS Direct Connect without Downtime

abstract: Moving hundreds of applications and thousands of servers to AWS requires planning and automation. In this builders session, we whiteboard how to plan your application migrations, discuss the best migration strategies for your applications, and explore how automation and AWS Migration Hub, AWS Application Discovery Service, AWS Server Migration Service, and AWS Database Migration Service can super charge your migrations at scale.
title: Plan, Track, and Execute Mass Migrations

abstract: In this hands-on session, you learn how to build a video recommendation engine by leveraging Amazon machine learning services and the fully managed graph database service, Amazon Neptune. You use Amazon Transcribe and the natural language processing service, Amazon Comprehend, to transcribe and extract metadata, such as key phrases, entities, topics, and sentiment from video blogs. The resulting connected metadata is organized into a Neptune graph database and used to drive recommendations for related videos.
title: Build a Video Recommendation Engine with Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, & Neptune

abstract: The development and application of machine learning (ML) models is a vital part of scientific and technical computing. Increasing model training data size generally improves model prediction and performance, but deploying models at scale is a challenge. Participants in this builder session learn to use Amazon SageMaker, an AWS service that simplifies the ML process and enables training on cloud-stored datasets at any scale. Attendees walk through the process of building a model, training it, and applying it for prediction against large open scientific datasets, such as the 1000 Genomes data. By the end of the session, attendees have the resources and experience to start using Amazon SageMaker and related AWS services to accelerate their scientific research and time to discovery.
title: Build a Genome Clustering Model with Amazon SageMaker

abstract: The Elasticsearch query DSL is feature-rich, providing you with the ability to write queries that quickly isolate and expose the information that's most important to you. Whether you're searching log data or application data, you need to understand the capabilities and how to use them. Let's dig in together and build the queries and ranking that you want.
title: Writing Elasticsearch Queries for Search

abstract: As organizations move from aggregating data from disparate sources to preparing the data for analytical workloads, they're constantly bottlenecked by the infrastructural limitations of their data warehousing infrastructure. Moving to a managed cloud data warehouse seems to be costly and risk-prone. This session takes you through an approach, personalized to your use case, for modernizing your data warehouse infrastructure powered by Amazon Redshift. It shows you how easy it is to migrate your setup to the cloud through AWS Database Migration Service, as well as how to migrate petabytes of data to the cloud quickly and securely with AWS Snowball, AWS Snowmobile, and other migration services.
title: Modernize Your Data Warehouse with Amazon Redshift

abstract: In this builders session, we discuss how to capture, process, and analyze video streams using Amazon Kinesis Video Streams. We walk through a high-level, end-to-end architecture, and we discuss the first steps to start streaming video in real time.
title: Getting Started with Streaming Video Using Amazon Kinesis Video Streams

abstract: AWS Step Functions is a fully-managed serverless workflow-management service. Using visual workflows, you can easily manage long-running processes and coordinate the components of distributed applications and microservices. Join us to learn how you can use Step Functions to implement the Saga design pattern, which is particularly useful for dealing with the complexities of a long-lived transaction that spans across distributed components in a microservices architecture. You need your own laptop with administrator permissions, with the AWS CLI, AWS SAM CLI, and Go installed, and an active AWS account with administrator permissions.
title: Manage Long-Lived Transactions with AWS Step Functions

abstract: An important aspect of developing immersive applications is the creation of a complete engaging environment. In this session, we show you how to modify the lighting, background, sky spheres, and sky boxes—settings for your scene that surround and establish the foundation for your immersive application.
title: Customizing the Environment in Your AR/VR Scene

abstract: Build, manage, and deploy your Alexa skills programmatically from the command line using the ASK command line interface (CLI).
title: Speed Alexa Skills Development with the ASK CLI

abstract: Business intelligence (BI) has been a manual, static process. Analysts and engineers must anticipate the right questions, monitor the right metrics, create dashboards, apply calculations, verify and validate results, and repeat the process—which means slow, reactive insights and dangerous blind spots across business operations. In this session, get hands-on with a range of datasets across use cases like product and customer experience analytics from ecommerce, web analytics, telco, ad tech, gaming, ride sharing, and IoT manufacturing. Learn how a new class of self-learning AI/ML tools is enabling autonomous analytics with trend and root cause detection services in real time. Anodot's SaaS analytics platform offers a simple self-service model with no data science expertise required, powered by AWS, Amazon Kinesis, and Amazon Redshift.
title: ML for Real-Time Self-Service Trend Detection & Root Cause Analysis: A Hands-On Lab

abstract: Consistent feedback and communication, as well as the use of quality controls, can impact your ability to derive quality content from your workers at scale. Join us for best practices for engaging the crowd.
title: Engage the Crowd for Better Results from Amazon Mechanical Turk

abstract: Amazon ECS Service Discovery helps your containerized services discover and connect with each other. In this session, we show you how service discovery works and how you can use it to simplify microservices running on Amazon ECS.
title: Getting Started with Amazon ECS Service Discovery

abstract: In this session, we discuss the basics of monitoring, logging, and tracing for containerized services running on AWS. We cover the available AWS tools as well as extension points for third-party applications.
title: Setting Up Logging and Monitoring for Containers

abstract: A well-designed GraphQL schema goes a long way towards ensuring a performant API. In this session, we dive deep into the GraphQL execution process. We then design optimal schemas for use with AWS AppSync, native resolvers, and subscriptions that work for common integration scenarios. We also cover best practices related to authentication and identity with GraphQL.
title: Advanced GraphQL Design Patterns with AWS AppSync

abstract: This hands-on session, we provide an orientation to the Amazon Sumerian console, IDE, scene templates, and asset library. By the end of this session, all participants will know how to set up an account, establish a scene template, and develop their first scene.
title: Create Your First AR/VR Scene in 60 Minutes

abstract: Evaluating the best database to use for a job isn't as clear as it was ten years ago. Join us in this session to review your relational and nonrelational database options on AWS to ensure the best fit for your application. We also discuss related topics, such as managed database services, serverless databases, and heterogeneous migrations between different database types.
title: Which Database Should I Use?

abstract: In this session, attendees work with data from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration containing accident, vehicle, and person information for certain years in the US. They predict the fatality in a specific car accident with machine learning, using the ML Data Readiness Package based on KNIME from AWS Marketplace.
title: Machine Learning and Predicting Risk

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to develop your first serverless REST API using AWS Lambda and AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local.
title: Serverless REST API

abstract: In this session, learn how to leverage Amazon S3, AWS Glue, Amazon Athena, and Amazon QuickSight to upload a dataset to your central data lake, automate the creation of a data catalog, transform data to a compressed columnar format that enables you to speed up and reduce the cost of your processes, query the data using standard SQL, and create and share rich web-based visualizations. See how you can perform serverless analytics without having to manage clusters or spin up a single instance.
title: Learn to Perform Serverless Analytics

abstract: Continuous integration and deployment for client-server applications takes planning. In this session, we show you how to use AWS and OSS tools to integrate AWS services into a mobile backend and then create a CI/CD pipeline for your serverless mobile backend using any CI/CD provider.
title: Automatically Deploying a Serverless Mobile Backend with CI/CD

abstract: Amazon S3 offers the most flexible management and administration capabilities to classify, report, and visualize your data usage trends so that you can make informed decisions to optimize performance and cost. Attend this builders session to learn how to use the following Amazon S3 management features: create and manage lifecycle policies, create and manage cross-region replication rules, configure storage class analysis, configure Amazon S3 inventory, and configure request metrics. Also learn how to use the latest Amazon S3 features in a controlled setting with members from our Amazon S3 team. Some knowledge of storage management and familiarity of the Amazon S3 console is recommended but not necessary.
title: Amazon S3 Storage Management

abstract: Come join us for this session on data protection on AWS. We discuss AWS services such as AWS Certificate Manager, AWS KMS, AWS Config, and AWS Secrets Manager. We also discuss your use cases and explore how AWS can help you achieve your protection goals.
title: Data Protection in AWS

abstract: In this session, we show how to monitor an over-the-top (OTT) video channel built with AWS Media Services. Users group media services into logical video channels to visualize channel connections and real-time alarms.
title: Monitor in Real Time a Live Video Channel Combined from Media Services

abstract: One of the benefits of having a data lake is that the same data can be consumed by multi-tenant groups—an efficient way to share a persistent Amazon EMR cluster. The same business data can be safely used for many different analytics and data processing needs. In this builders session, we discuss steps to make an Amazon EMR cluster multi-tenant for analytics, best practices for a multi-tenant cluster, and solving common challenges. We also address security and governance aspects of a multi-tenant Amazon EMR cluster.
title: One Data Lake, Many Uses: Enable Multi-Tenant Analytics with Amazon EMR

abstract: Are you tired of hacking together email appliances and using error-prone client rules to solve users' modern email challenges? Instead, use AWS Lambda with WorkMail to take the exact actions you want. Teams increasingly want specific solutions to their productivity problems. Serverless computing for email enables you to build the exact solutions these teams need without the complexity, cost, and errors that accompany email rules and in-transit messages. In this session, we show you how to rally your team around a new task using the tools they prefer today. We provide an example that explores how to selectively direct email communication from WorkMail to an Amazon Chime chat room using AWS Lambda and other AWS services.
title: Simplify Your Corporate Email System with Lambda for Email

abstract: Once your data is in Amazon Elasticsearch Service, you need to understand Kibana, how it works, and what you can do with it. In this session we answer your questions and guide you on building the visualizations you want.
title: Using Kibana with Amazon Elasticsearch Service

abstract: In this builders session, we discuss common use cases across various AWS data analytics platforms that are integrated with AWS Glue Data Catalog, and we share best practices for using AWS Glue Data Catalog and crawlers on services such as Amazon Athena, Amazon Redshift Spectrum, and Amazon EMR. Participants set up and launch crawlers on sample datasets and execute queries on various analytics services.
title: Get the Most out of AWS Glue Data Catalog and Crawlers for Data Lake Analytics

abstract: Amazon Transcribe is an automatic speech recognition service that makes it easy for developers to add speech-to-text capability to their applications. Join us and learn how you can build machine transcription into your existing workflows, such as transcribing videos for search engines or captioning.
title: Machine Learning Transcription: Tips & Tricks

abstract: In this session, learn how to use the range of built-in, high-performance machine learning algorithms that come with Amazon SageMaker.
title: Amazon SageMaker: Prebuilt Algorithms

abstract: In this session, we walk you though the new features of Amazon Redshift workload management and the potential it offers to tune your cluster for the best query performance for your workloads. You'll be empowered with tools and tips to understand your current configuration and how to perform the needed optimizations. Walk away from the session with the confidence that your clusters are firing on all cylinders.
title: Amazon Redshift Workload Management - Deep Dive

abstract: Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics enables you to quickly build and easily manage applications that process streaming data in real-time. In this builders session, we walk through the steps required to build a streaming application, including the most common issues and best practices.
title: Build a Streaming Application Using Amazon Kinesis

abstract: Continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) with EC2 Auto Scaling can accelerate feature delivery, ensure the highest availability, and lower costs. In this session, we provide a hands-on experience in deploying your web app in an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group and setting up a CI/CD pipeline with AWS CodeDeploy and AWS CodePipeline. Learn best practices for setting up your EC2 Auto Scaling groups and scaling policies for a resilient infrastructure environment at the lowest cost.
title: Deploy a Resilient and Cost-Effective App with EC2 Auto Scaling and CI/CD

abstract: In this session, learn how to set up a CI/CD pipeline for AWS Fargate with AWS CodePipeline.
title: Set up CI/CD for AWS Fargate with AWS CodePipeline

abstract: Forecasting demand is essential for business owners and managers to make smarter, accurate, and profitable decisions. For example, the rising demand for fast food and increasing diversity of available options results in erratic demand for quick service restaurants. This solution helps analyze trends and plan for inventory availability, preventing food wastage and staff scheduling, thus resulting in increased savings. In this session, you get an overview of the automated deployment of the ML model, accompanied by hands-on experience with Amazon SageMaker. The solution implements deep learning models on Amazon SageMaker for faster training through parallelization and accurate results. Learn how to interpret model output and tweak the hyperparameters for iterative experiments, and plug in your own datasets for quick insights.
title: Demand Forecasting Using Deep Learning

abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender helps continuously audit security configurations for compliance with security best practices. Audits are performed for one or more sets of checks and can be configured to send notifications to SNS with findings. In this session, we walk through creating scheduled audits that run periodically as well as on-demand. We also walk through how to perform mitigation actions based on audit findings.
title: Audit Your Device Fleet with AWS IoT Device Defender

abstract: In this session, we provide an interactive, hands-on environment for anything you want to learn or build on VMware Cloud on AWS. Roll up your sleeves, get out your laptop, and come prepared with questions. We want you get the most out of VMware Cloud on AWS.
title: Build on VMware Cloud on AWS

abstract: In this builders session, we walk through the first three parts of a five-part tutorial on how to build Wildrydes, a unicorn ride-hailing web app. Learn how to configure Amazon S3 to host the static resource, create an Amazon Cognito user pool to manage your users' accounts, and add dynamic functionality to your web app using JavaScript to call remote RESTful APIs built with AWS Lambda and Amazon API Gateway.
title: Build the Serverless Web App, Wildrydes

abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR) to securly manage and distribute your Docker container images.
title: Managing Docker Images with Amazon ECR

abstract: Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) supports Docker networking and integrates with Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC). In this session, we cover the basics of selecting and using a networking mode for containers managed by Amazon ECS.
title: Container Networking on AWS

abstract: Automatic scaling helps ensure that the right number of containers are running to support the load on your application. In this session, we show you how to configure automatic scaling based on custom metrics using Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS).
title: Setting Up Automatic Scaling for Amazon EKS

abstract: Amazon EFS brings an easy-to-use, highly available, highly durable, elastic file storage to a wide variety of applications. In this session, AWS experts share best practices for optimizing performance when accessing data from your Amazon EFS file system. We go into detail on the performance modes within Amazon EFS and how to design your workload to get the most of your file system.
title: Get the Most out of Your Amazon EFS Deployment

abstract: In this session, we explore Android architecture components for lifecycle management, LiveData, ViewModel, and SQLite persistence, and we show you how you can access AWS services using this new Android architectural pattern.
title: Modern Android Application Architecture with AWS

abstract: In this builders session, we start a simple serverless project locally and debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local. Once it is prepared to go into AWS, we create a CI/CD pipeline for our new serverless application using AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS CloudFormation.
title: AWS SAM: From Local Debugging to CI/CD

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to use AWS Step Functions to orchestrate serverless IT automation workflows in response to Amazon CloudWatch Events. These events are sourced from AWS Health, a service that monitors and generates events for your AWS resources. We also share a real-world example of automating the response to a scenario where an IAM user access key has been exposed.
title: Automate IT Operations with AWS Step Functions & Amazon CloudWatch Events

abstract: AWS Config tracks changes to the configuration of your resources and checks your resources for compliance against best practices and policies. In this session, learn how to aggregate data from multiple accounts and regions in your enterprise into a central account, using the multi-account, multi-region data aggregation feature in AWS Config. Learn how to create an aggregator that collects data from your AWS Organizations, use the aggregated dashboard, and query the AWS Config APIs to retrieve this information programmatically.
title: Audit Your AWS Resource Configuration across Accounts & Regions

abstract: In this session, create a conversational interface with Amazon Lex which recognizes and answers common questions received through chat or voice. Become familiar with an Amazon Lex chatbot and its constructs, such as intents, utterances, and slots.
title: Creating a Support Chatbot

abstract: In this session, learn how to easily debug and trace unhandled errors, performance bottlenecks, and customer impact in the distributed nature of a microservices architecture.
title: Microservices Insights with AWS X-Ray

abstract: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers. In this session, we cover how to use Amazon CloudWatch Events that you define to run containers on AWS Fargate.
title: Triggering AWS Fargate Containers with Amazon CloudWatch Events

abstract: In this session, we review and configure several Amazon CloudFront security features such as TLS/SSL certificate management, security groups, OAI, token authentication, and field-level encryption.
title: Secure Your Site: Use CDN Security Features to Protect Your Content & Infrastructure

abstract: In this session, learn how to customize the routing in Amazon Connect for scenarios such as VIP customers, second tier and fallback support, and holiday or emergency handling. We guide you through building queues, routing profiles, and contact flows to solve for these advanced routing use cases. In the second half of this session, we explore how to solve for the specific routing use cases you may have.
title: Design and Configure Advanced Routing Strategies for Amazon Connect

abstract: Get hands on with serverless data processing at scale. In this session, we use Landsat 8 satellite imagery to calculate a Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) across multiple points of interest in the world using the GeoTIFF data across multiple spectral bands.
title: Massively Parallel Data Processing at Scale

abstract: In this hands-on training session, we show you how to create a chatbot using Sumerian Hosts integrated with Amazon Polly and Amazon Lex. Bringing voice and conversation transforms the way in which scenes are developed and how customers interact with an app. Learn how to create a chatbot using both verbal and typed inputs and responses.
title: Creating a Chatbot

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to use Amazon Kinesis and AWS Lambda to tackle various real-time processing needs. We share helpful hints on how to configure your stream and AWS Lambda function, how to monitor your processing, and we share some use cases on the types of processing you can do.
title: Serverless Real-Time Data Processing

abstract: Whether you're migrating existing workloads or creating something new in AWS, it can be tempting to bring your current security solutions with you. This session helps you identify which cloud-native solutions can mitigate the same risks while providing scalability, reliability, and cost optimization at a low operational burden. (SGs & NACLs, Amazon GuardDuty, SSM Run command and SSH)
title: Mitigate Risks Using Cloud-Native Infrastructure Security

abstract: In this session, learn how AWS Auto Scaling enables you to configure scaling for all your application resources in as few as three steps.
title: Managing Application Costs and Performance Using AWS Auto Scaling

abstract: In this session, learn how to use TensorFlow in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.
title: Amazon SageMaker and TensorFlow: Tips & Tricks

abstract: DNS management and consistent naming across multiple VPCs and multiple accounts can often be a challenge. In this session, we implement a solution that provides a unified namespace across on-premises and AWS environments. Bring your laptop.
title: Centralizing DNS Management in a Multi-Account Environment

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to build a management and patching strategy with AWS Systems Manager for on-premise and cloud resources.
title: AWS Systems Manager for Microsoft Workloads

abstract: In this session, learn about reducing your production downtime with blue/green deployments. Learn how to quickly build your deployment pipeline using AWS CodePipeline, and take a deep dive into AWS CodeDeploy.
title: Deploy Your Web App Safely with Blue/Green Deployments

abstract: In this this session, we provide insights into advanced settings to increase the performance of your scene by optimizing the environment, adjusting settings, modifying asset size, etc. Come prepared to raise questions, discuss challenges, and create solutions with experienced Amazon Sumerian experts.
title: Optimizing Your Immersive Application: Tips & Tricks from the Experts

abstract: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database with the speed, reliability, and availability of commercial databases at one-tenth the cost. Join this session, and get started with the PostgreSQL-compatible edition, discuss your existing application running on Aurora, or learn about recently announced features, such as Fast Database Cloning or Performance Insights.
title: Build on Amazon Aurora with PostgreSQL Compatibility

abstract: In this session, follow a hands-on example of running machine learning (ML) inference on AWS Greengrass. You use an ML model trained in the AWS Cloud using Amazon SageMaker and deploy the model to an AWS Greengrass core. By the end of the session, expect to have a good understanding of how to implement edge intelligence with AWS Greengrass.
title: Learn the Essentials of Machine Learning Inference with AWS Greengrass

abstract: Permission boundaries is probably one of the most important new IAM feature in awhile. This feature addresses a longstanding customer issue, namely, how do I delegate administration to my users. If you have developers that need to be able to create role for Lambda functions, system admins that need to be able to create IAM roles and users, or any similar scenario, then you need permission boundaries.
title: Permission Boundaries: How to Truly Delegate Permissions on AWS

abstract: Machine learning (ML) outcomes are only as good as the data they are built upon. Preparing data for ML is time consuming and cumbersome; “data wrangling” for analytics can consume over 80% of project effort. ML Wrangling Assistant, based on Trifacta running on AWS, streamlines ML applications so teams can focus on the work that matters—creating accurate predictions that improve products, services, and organizational efficiency. In this lab, we cover one of two data preparation use cases. Marketing Analytics analyzes web ads by cleaning and transforming ecommerce transactions in a relational table combined to a clickstream semi-structured log file. Cross-Sell Analytics explores, structures, standardizes, and combines multiple file types (CSV, JSON, Excel) to create a single, consistent view of customers. Final outputs are the categorical features and attributes to train, test, and validate the data sets required by Amazon SageMaker to perform ML modeling.
title: Democratize Data Preparation for Analytics & Machine Learning: A Hands-On Lab

abstract: Knowledge graphs are a powerful way to relate information. In this session, learn how to build a knowledge graph with Amazon Neptune by using Metaphactory.
title: Build Knowledge Graphs with Amazon Neptune

abstract: In this session, we demonstrate when and how to engage users in real time based on events and user behaviors to drive contextual and relevant user interactions. The intended audience is developers who are supporting marketing activities using AWS services.
title: How to Use Amazon Pinpoint and Amazon Kinesis for Events-Based Messaging

abstract: In this builders session, we describe how to create a continuous deployment architecture for containerized applications. We use AWS CodeCommit, AWS CodePipeline, AWS CodeBuild, and AWS Lambda to deploy containerized applications into a Kubernetes cluster. In this environment, developers can remain focused on developing code without worrying about how it will be deployed, and development managers can be satisfied that the latest changes are always deployed.
title: Continuous Deployment to Kubernetes Using AWS Services

abstract: Automating and coding your infrastructure can have your business up and running again within minutes or hours, rather than days or weeks after an event. DevSecOps is the ability to secure and define your infrastructure as code and validate its functionality. In terms of business continuity, what does this look like, and how does it work? What are main benefits to BC by using infrastructure as code?
title: Achieving Business Continuity in AWS through DevSecOps

abstract: Amazon DynamoDB is a non-relational database that delivers reliable performance at any scale. It's a fully managed, multi-region, multi-master database that provides consistent single-digit millisecond latency, and it offers built-in security, backup and restore, and in-memory caching. Come to this session to learn how DynamoDB can help your business scale.
title: Build Internet-Scale Apps with Amazon DynamoDB

abstract: GraphQL is great when you are starting an app from scratch. Do you know that you can also migrate an existing app to use GraphQL? In this session, we migrate an app that uses REST and RPC APIs to GraphQL on AWS AppSync, and we discuss the best practices to follow for the migration.
title: Migrating Your App from REST to GraphQL

abstract: AWS Glue provides a horizontally scalable platform for running ETL jobs against a wide variety of data sources. In this builders session, we cover techniques for understanding and optimizing the performance of your jobs using Glue job metrics. Learn how to identify bottlenecks on the driver and executors, identify and fix data skew, tune the number of DPUs, and address common memory errors.
title: Metrics-Driven Performance Tuning for AWS Glue ETL Jobs

abstract: In this session, we focus on launch templates and their usage through Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling and AWS CloudFormation. Launch templates are designed to be an interactive, hands-on environment for anything you want to build. Learn about managing your Auto Scaling groups using launch templates. Roll up your sleeves, get your laptop out, and ask us anything you want to about your project.
title: Manage Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling Groups via AWS CloudFormation & Launch Templates

abstract: In this hands-on session, you use the natural language processing service, Amazon Comprehend, to extract key phrases, entities, topics, and sentiment from social media posts about government agency programs, such as TSA PreCheck, upcoming public transit initiatives, and the next NASA Mars rover mission. You then use the results to estimate the overall public opinion about each program.
title: Use Sentiment Analysis of Social Media Posts to Gauge Public Opinion

abstract: In this session, you use an automated test suite to bombard an application with an increasing number of concurrent users. You then identify the bottlenecks and refactor the application. Discover how many concurrent users can you get to.
title: Scale up a Web Application

abstract: Join us for a deep dive on building a searchable image library using Amazon Rekognition. We walk though creating a search index for objects and scenes so you can quickly retrieve images using labels created from automatic metadata extraction. Also learn how to use AWS Lambda to automatically maintain your image library.
title: Build a Searchable Image Library with Amazon Rekognition

abstract: Are you looking for the fastest way to get started with serverless though a hands-on experience? This builders session is for you. Join us as we build an API using Python, AWS Lambda, Amazon API Gateway, and AWS X-Ray.
title: Build and Deploy a Serverless API Under 60 Minutes

abstract: Imagine that you work for a marketing agency that has tens of thousands of stock images. You find that many images don’t have descriptive file names and that others are completely mislabeled. You don’t want to spend hours and hours relabeling them and moving them around to different folders. What if you could find the images you need without relying on metadata? In this session, we deploy an end-to-end solution to show you how to do this using Amazon Rekognition and AWS Lambda.
title: Serverless Photo Recognition System

abstract: In this session, learn how to personalize and improve the look, feel, and behavior of your app and increase engagement and retention by combining AWS AppSync and Amazon Pinpoint for segmentation, A/B testing, and personalization.
title: A/B Testing Application Behavior to Improve User Experience and Retention

abstract: In this builders session, we demonstrate how to grant temporary remote access or high privilege access to users and automatically revoke permissions. We use AWS Service Catalog to automate the process, and then we use AWS Systems Manager to provision SSH access for a limited time to perform diagnostics. When we complete, access will be removed. Attendees need an account that can provision AWS Lambda, Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2), AWS Service Catalog, AWS Systems Manager, Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS), AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), and Amazon CloudWatch Events.
title: Perform Diagnostics on Running Instances without Affecting Availability & Reliability

abstract: Interested in knowing how you can safely deploy over-the-air (OTA) updates with AWS IoT Device Management? In this session, learn how AWS IoT Device Management allows you to push software and firmware to devices in the field to patch security vulnerabilities and improve device functionality.
title: Learn to Safely Deploy OTA Updates with AWS IoT Device Management

abstract: In this session, learn how to deploy a complete networking environment on AWS using AWS CloudFormation. By the end of this session, you will be confident in managing your infrastructure as code. Bring your laptops.
title: Using AWS CloudFormation to Manage Networking in AWS

abstract: Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data so you can get timely insights and react quickly to new information. The first problem customers solve using Amazon Kinesis is how to get data into a stream. In this builders session, we walk you through the options of writing data to a stream and the pros and cons of each option.
title: Ingesting High-Volume, High-Speed Data Using Amazon Kinesis

abstract: In this session, you start your first serverless application using AWS CodeStar to set up a CI/CD. Then, we debug our AWS Lambda functions using AWS Serverless Application Model (AWS SAM) Local with AWS Cloud9. Finally, we learn about monitoring distributed applications with AWS X-Ray and Amazon CloudWatch.
title: Set Up a Serverless CI/CD Pipeline with AWS CodeStar

abstract: In this session, we walk you through the process of creating an immersive application that is then published and consumed via virtual reality (VR). The one-click publishing feature in Amazon Sumerian enables you to build once and then publish to an array of devices. Sumerian supports Oculus Rift, Oculus Go, HTC Vive, HTC Vive Pro, Lenovo Mirage Solo, and Google Daydream headsets, which run a compatible browser and enable the user to experience the scene in VR.
title: Entering VR: Create and Publish a Virtual Reality Scene with Sumerian

abstract: Are you developing innovative IoT solutions and need to securely connect your devices to AWS? Or are you simply curious about how microcontroller units (MCUs) talk to AWS IoT and onboard peripherals? Join us in this session, and learn how Amazon FreeRTOS can enable you to push sensor readings securely to AWS.
title: Get Started on Amazon FreeRTOS

abstract: Visibility into your AWS infrastructure is a critical aspect of security and compliance. In this session, learn how to enable API calls through AWS CloudTrail as well as set up alert notifications in Amazon CloudWatch.
title: Monitoring and Logging in AWS

abstract: In this session, we focus on the fundamentals for beginning your SAN migration strategy to the cloud. Get hands-on experience setting up Amazon EBS volumes, and learn how to optimize your volumes for performance, availability, and durability.
title: Cloud Data Migration with Amazon EBS

abstract: Image optimization saves time, money and creates a better user experience. In this session, configure a dynamically scalable real-time image optimization service to resize and compress images for various experiences and devices using Amazon Cloudfront and Lambda@Edge.
title: Image Optimization at the Edge with Amazon CloudFront and Lambda@Edge

abstract: Get an overview of how to run Kuberetes on AWS. We cover the basics of Kuberentes and show you how to get started with Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS), including starting a cluster, adding worker nodes, and running your first containerized app.
title: Running Kubernetes with Amazon EKS

abstract: Autoscaling helps ensure the right amount of containers are running to support load on your application. In this session, we will show you how the ways to configure autoscaling using containers managed by Amazon ECS
title: Autoscaling with ECS and Fargate

abstract: When developing mobile apps, sometimes you don’t have the right device in hand to reproduce a problem. AWS Device Farm has thousands of devices available, and you can use these to diagnose the problem. In this session, we show you how to install and run your app using a device in the cloud, use the Android Studio debugger to diagnose the problem by setting breakpoints and stepping through the code, measure app performance using Android Profiler, and write sample tests using instrumentation to ensure the problem is tested in the future.
title: How to Debug an Android App in the Cloud Using Android Studio

abstract: In this builders session, we show you how to use your own custom-trained models with AWS Lambda to leverage a simplified serverless computing approach at scale. In the process, we introduce you to some of the core AWS services that you can use to run your inference with serverless, including AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, AWS CloudFormation, Amazon CloudWatch, and AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). The languages and deep learning frameworks we use include Python and TensorFlow. In addition, we show you how the processes can be applied with any other deep learning frameworks, such as MXNet, Caffe, PyTorch, and CNTK.
title: Deploy Deep Learning Models with AWS Lambda

abstract: Understanding, analyzing, controlling, and optimizing your AWS costs is easier than ever with our native AWS products. In this interactive session, we cover the basic and advanced capabilities of Cost Explorer, AWS Budgets, and their associated APIs. We also provide hands-on training for how to use these products effectively in real-world environments.
title: How to Use Cost Explorer and Budgets to Manage Your AWS Costs

abstract: Many of today's text-to-speech systems limit your choices to a few voices. If these voices aren't right for your needs, the process of adding more voices is usually costly and time consuming. Learn how you can use Amazon Polly for speech production and to modify voices for a range of uses, from game development and telephony to web publishing.
title: Create the Voices You Want with Amazon Polly

abstract: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) is a popular choice for moving new and legacy Oracle Database workloads to the cloud. Join us in this session to discuss your migration and licensing options, learn about recent Amazon RDS for Oracle features, and go deep on database performance and high availability.
title: Build on Amazon RDS for Oracle

abstract: In this builders session, we write XCUI tests for iOS from scratch and run the tests against real devices in the cloud.
title: Native iOS Test Automation for Developers

abstract: Streaming application architectures are commonly used to solve real-time analytics requirements. Serverless architectures are a great fit for stream-processing applications because they enable you to lower operational costs, pay per execution, and they can seamlessly scale as your stream data rates vary. In this workshop, learn how to create serverless stream processing architectures that can seamlessly scale as your needs grow. Get hands-on experience using Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose, Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics, and AWS Lambda to create real-time analytics pipelines. Learn how to ingest streaming data at scale and process it to generate insights in real-time.
title: Architecture Patterns of Serverless Stream Processing at Scale

abstract: If loading data into your data warehouse is a big pain point for you, come join us as we provide best practices to make your data pipeline more performant and reliable. Learn how to generate the schema for your semi-structured data, create ETL code to transform, flatten, and enrich your data, and load your data warehouse on a recurring basis.
title: ETL or ELT - Amazon Redshift Makes It Easy

abstract: Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose is the easiest way to reliably load streaming data into data stores and analytics tools. In this builders session, we discuss how to use Kinesis Data Firehose to ingest, transform, and deliver data to Amazon S3 in a format that you can easily process.
title: Delivering Fresh Data to Your Data Lake Using Amazon Kinesis

abstract: Amazon S3 and Amazon Glacier provide the most robust security solutions and features to protect your data in the cloud. In this builders session, you have the opportunity to dive deep into specific security needs for your data, working with an Amazon S3 technical expert to help you make your data more secure in the cloud than it was in your own data center.
title: Builders Session: Secure Data in Amazon S3 & Amazon Glacier

abstract: Through this demonstration, see how easy it is to build a fully functional and secure cloud-native application in hours rather than in days or weeks. This demo includes the use of AWS Cloud9, a cloud-based IDE, to build a fully serverless cloud native application in React using the AWS Mobile Hub via the AWS Mobile CLI and AWS Amplify.
title: Set Up a Serverless App Using React and AWS Amplify

abstract: Experts from the .NET SDK engineering team would love to help answer your questions related to the .NET experience on AWS, including questions about the SDK for .NET, AWS Lambda with .NET, AWS Lambda support for PowerShell, and AWS Tools for Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS). Come and chat with us.
title: .NET on AWS: Problem Solving with AWS Software Engineers

abstract: When you migrate your web application to the AWS Cloud, you can eliminate several internet threats just by architecting correctly. In this session, learn how AWS Shield automatically safeguards your AWS infrastructure against common network and transport-layer DDoS attacks. Also learn how to use AWS WAF to protect against sophisticated application-layer threats. Finally, learn how to leverage AWS services, such as Elastic Load Balancing, Amazon CloudFront, and Amazon Route 53, to scale your application in response to a large increase in traffic.
title: Web Application Security

abstract: In this session, learn how to manage your device lifecycle from start to finish with AWS IoT Device Management. By the end of this session, expect to understand how to onboard devices, organize device inventory, monitor a fleet of devices, and remotely manage and update devices deployed across many locations.
title: Manage Your IoT Device Lifecycle with AWS IoT Device Management

abstract: Learn how to build a multichannel conversational interface that uses a preprocessing layer in front of Amazon Lex, or route messages to other specialized bots. Amazon Lex offers built-in integrations with Slack, Twilio, Marketo, Salesforce, QuickBooks, Microsoft Dynamics, Zendesk, and HubSpot. Also learn how to integrate with any other application by combining the Amazon Lex API and Amazon API Gateway to integrate your Amazon Lex bot with any messaging service.
title: Build Multichannel Conversational Interfaces Using Amazon Lex

abstract: In this builders session, you build and deploy a completely serverless application using Amazon API Gateway, AWS Lambda, Amazon SQS, and Amazon Cognito. Learn how to model these resources in AWS CloudFormation and connect them all into a single application.
title: Build and Deploy a Completely Serverless Application

abstract: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed Redis and Memcached, which you can use to seamlessly deploy, run, and scale popular open-source compatible in-memory data stores. Come to this session to learn how to build data-intensive apps or improve the performance of your existing apps by retrieving data from high throughput and low latency in-memory data stores.
title: Build High-Performance Apps with Amazon ElastiCache

abstract: In this session, learn how to use Chainer, an open-source deep learning framework written in Python, in the Amazon SageMaker machine learning platform.
title: Amazon SageMaker and Chainer: Tips & Tricks

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to debug your serverless applications with AWS X-Ray.
title: Debug Serverless Applications with AWS X-Ray

abstract: In this session, get general help on how to build or extend a project with AWS DeepLens.
title: AWS DeepLens Projects: Tips & Tricks

abstract: In this session, we review how to deploy an AWS Greengrass core and create a local AWS Lambda function to control virtual devices based on temperature. Come and explore how devices update using the device shadow and how to scale device deployments in the real world.
title: Device Command and Control with AWS Greengrass

abstract: AWS IoT Device Defender continuously monitors device behavior. You can define behavior profiles that define expected device behavior and trigger alerts when a device violates that profile. In this session, we implement automated responses to AWS IoT Device Defender alerts in order to help you diagnose and remediate violations in your device fleet.
title: Detect Abnormal Device Behavior with AWS IoT Device Defender

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster Instance on AWS.
title: Deploy a SQL Server Failover Cluster on AWS

abstract: In this session, we discuss and demonstrate techniques and tools for identifying expensive queries as well as strategies for improving performance. The intended audience is developers, DBAs, and DBEs who are using Amazon Aurora or considering it.
title: Identify & Address Query Performance Issues in Aurora

abstract: Not all of your data is always loaded into your data warehouse, and yet sometimes anaysts need access to it quickly, without waiting on an ETL job to load it. This sessions takes a hands-on approach to show you how to mine your Amazon S3 data lake using open data formats with Amazon Redshift Spectrum, a feature of Amazon Redshift, without the need for unnecessary data movement. This enables you to analyze data across your data warehouse and data lake together, with a single service.
title: Build a Query to Analyze Data in Your Amazon Redshift Warehouse & S3 Data Lake Together

abstract: In this session, we use AWS Trusted Advisor and AWS Personal Health Dashboard in conjunction with AWS Lambda, AWS Step Functions, and AWS Systems Manager to build automation from scratch in order to reduce risk, improve security, and optimize the performance of your AWS environments. Please bring your own laptop.
title: Build Automated Actions Using AWS Support Tools

abstract: In this session, learn to use the state machine to bring behaviors and interactivity to objects within their scene. Together, we create an interactive 3D scene using primitive shapes and basic objects. Learn how to import assets, change their position within a scene, and creative interactive behaviors using the state machine.
title: The State Machine: Create Dynamic, Interactive AR, VR, & 3D Experiences

abstract: In this builders session on containers, we will cover how to optimize your Kubernetes clusters (Amazon EKS) by using a mixed worker node group of Amazon EC2 On-Demand and Spot Instances. We will cover concepts of provisioning instances, scaling, and handling interruptions. The session will provide material for a hands-on guide for developers and operations to explore and get familiar.
title: Optimize Amazon EKS with Amazon EC2 Fleet

abstract: Learn how to customize your application streaming environment, automate image, fleet and stack management, and scale while optimizing your utilization. To participate in this builder session, you must have an active AppStream 2.0 fleet. You can build one in our workshop, Build an Amazon AppStream 2.0 Environment to Deliver Desktop Applications to Any Computer.
title: Enhance Your Amazon AppStream 2.0 Environments: Branding, Automation, and More

abstract: In this session, learn how to build a VPN overlay on AWS Direct Connect such that all traffic over the connection is encrypted. Bring your laptop.
title: Encryption in Transit Approaches for AWS Direct Connect

abstract: In this session, we build a dynamic TV channel with live recorded content from the Royal Wedding, implementing ML media analytics to provide real-time annotation and translated subtitles. Use AWS Media Services to ingest and package video streams. Leverage the Media Analysis Solution, or use Amazon ML Services—Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Translate, and Amazon Comprehend—directly to add video intelligence and make the content more meaningful for your audience. Use AWS to deliver the content visitors want to see, the way they want to see it.
title: Build Interactive Live Video with Amazon ML Featuring the Royal Wedding

abstract: Use AWS Step Functions along with Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Transcribe, and Amazon Comprehend to build a serverless application that extracts meaningful data from audio, image, and video files.
title: Build a Serverless Media Analysis & Image Processing Solution

abstract: In this session, learn how to use Amazon Rekognition Video with Amazon Kinesis to receive and process video streams. We walk through recognizing faces, giving access to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams, as well as starting and reading the streaming video analysis. Whether you are building a "Who's Who" app similar to the royal wedding, or you need to identify athletes in real time, it is simple to add intelligent video analysis to your live streams using Amazon Rekognition.
title: Analyze Live Video Streams with Amazon Rekognition Video

abstract: Querying and analyzing big data can be complicated and expensive. It requires you to set up and manage databases, data warehouses, and business intelligence (BI) applications—all of which require time, effort, and resources. Using Amazon Athena and Amazon QuickSight, you can avoid the cost and complexity by creating a fast, scalable, and serverless cloud analytics solution without the need to invest in databases, data warehouses, complex ETL solutions, and BI applications. In this builders session, we demonstrate how you can build a serverless big data analytics solution using Amazon Athena and Amazon QuickSight.
title: Building Serverless Analytics Solutions with Amazon QuickSight

abstract: In this session, you have the opportunity to learn the fundamental building blocks of a data lake on AWS. You design and build a serverless pipeline to ingest, process, optimize and query data in your very own data lake. We discuss different optimizations and best practices to tune your architecture for future growth.
title: Building Your First Serverless Data Lake

abstract: From refined products to heavy crude, Four-Path Ultrasonic Flow Meters offers the capability to minimize measurement uncertainty of liquid hydrocarbons. Attendees work to build a machine learning (ML) predictive quality management (PQM) solution on AWS to proactively predict the health of the ultrasonic flow meters. This is done using the ML Data Readiness Package based on KNIME, from AWS Marketplace. Another PQM example for attendees to explore uses features extracted from motor current measured with a current probe and an oscilloscope on two phases measured under different speeds, load moments, and load forces. ML is used to proactively classify whether the motor has intact or defective components. A third PQM example involves using raw process sensor data from a hydraulic test rig with a primary working and a secondary cooling-filtration circuit, connected via the oil tank. They then use ML on AWS to proactively predict the cooler condition, hydraulic accumulator condition, internal pump leakage condition, and valve condition.
title: Machine Learning and Predictive Quality Management

abstract: Come learn how Soracom built an IoT-scale telecom-grade mobile packet core on AWS, enabling a vast ecosystem of applications that can use SIM-based IoT devices that integrate with AWS IoT. This session highlights the architectural best practices, telecom-partner integrations, and tips that make IoT deployments and management easier. You get the chance to work on interesting devices and build a live IoT sensor application.
title: Build an IoT Application with IoT-Scale Telecom Infrastructure on the Cloud

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to deploy a multi-region SQL Server Always-On Cluster.
title: Deploy a SQL Server Multi-Region Always On Availability Group Cluster

abstract: AWS supports a robust suite of tools and services that makes analyzing and processing large amounts of data in the cloud faster and more efficient. In this builders session, AWS storage and data experts guide you through Amazon S3, Amazon Glacier, and our query-in-place services such as Amazon S3 Select, Amazon Glacier Select, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Redshift Spectrum. We also provide best practices around using them with other analytics services like Amazon EMR and AWS Glue to build data lakes and deploy other analytics solutions. Understanding of a data lake construct, AWS storage services, and AWS analytics tools is recommended.
title: Query in Place with AWS

abstract: AWS offers a range of tools to allow you to move fast while still ensuring that your cloud resources comply with organizational standards and best practices. In this session, we include instruction on how to use Amazon Inspector, AWS Config, and AWS CloudFormation to enhance security and governance of your infrastructure.
title: Inventory and Configuration in AWS

abstract: In this session, learn how to integrate AWS IoT services, AWS Greengrass, Amazon Machine Learning, and Amazon Sumerian. We demonstrate real-time inference analysis of photographs for object recognition, and we hold a discussion on applying these capabilities to other use cases and industries.
title: Machine Learning in the Edge - Enhanced by Amazon Sumerian

abstract: Building human-in-the-loop solutions can be very effective, but integrating humans into existing ML or business process workflows can be complex. Learn how you can easily connect the Amazon Mechanical Turk (Mechanical Turk) on-demand human intelligence platform with other AWS services, such as Amazon S3, Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, and Amazon Rekognition with AWS Lambda.
title: Build Human-in-the-Loop Systems with AWS Lambda and Mechanical Turk

abstract: How can you make the smart home smarter? In this session, learn the most common use cases for analytics in the connected home. Attendees get hands-on experience implementing AWS IoT Analytics using data points common in connected home applications.
title: IoT Analytics in the Connected Home

abstract: In this builders session, learn how to build a serverless Twitter bot with AWS Lambda and Python.
title: Build a Serverless Twitter Bot

abstract: Notifying people through the many different channels they might be using can be daunting, whether it is for paging purposes or for a purely contextual notification. In this session, we use AWS Step Functions to create a notifications workflow and Amazon API Gateway to create a simpler API to notify people, be it on email, SMS or Slack.
title: Build Your Notifications Workflow with AWS Step Functions

abstract: AWS Glue makes it easy to incorporate data from a variety of sources into your data lake on Amazon S3. In this builders session, we demonstrate building complex workflows using AWS Glue orchestration capabilities. Learn about different types of AWS Glue triggers to create workflows for scheduled as well as event-driven processing. We start with a customer scenario and build it step by step using AWS Glue capabilities.
title: Build Advanced Workflows with AWS Glue

abstract: In this builders session, get hands-on experience deploying a web app via Amazon EC2 Fleet on Spot Instances and On-Demand. Amazon EC2 Spot Instances offer spare compute capacity in the AWS Cloud available at steep discounts compared to On-Demand prices. Learn how to deploy a fleet of instances behind a load balancer and scale it to handle peak demand with Spot Instances, all while saving up to 90% on your compute costs.
title: Building High-Scale Web Apps on Amazon EC2 Fleet

abstract: Graph databases offer a way to leverage the connectedness of your data and simplify the identification of underlying patterns. A strong use case for graph databases is to identify complex patterns of fraud that can be difficult to uncover in traditional relational database representations. In this hands-on session, you leverage the fully managed graph database service, Amazon Neptune, to identify fraudulent activity in highly connected data. You will also learn how to utilize a partner solution by Tom Sawyer Software, in concert with your graph data in Amazon Neptune, to create applications with enterprise-class data visualizations and analytics.
title: Fraud Detection with Amazon Neptune

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to explore several PowerShell use cases on AWS.
title: AWS Tools for PowerShell

abstract: This is a hands-on session where you are guided on how to create a shared services VPC. Shared services VPCs often contain resources like authentication, security services, logging, and more. We provide examples of how to share these services over both AWS PrivateLink and VPC peering. Bring your laptops.
title: Shared Services VPCs: VPC Peering & AWS PrivateLink Designs

abstract: Schema on read, enabled by the separation of metadata and compute, is a powerful feature of Amazon Athena. In this session, we dive deeper into how to better utilize this concept, properly plan for schema evolution, design efficient partitioning scheme, and apply other tips and tricks for working with metadata.
title: Working with Metadata in AWS Glue Data Catalog & Amazon Athena

abstract: Sumerian's browser-based authoring tool reduces the complexity of creating an augmented reality (AR) application. In this session, participants learn how to use Sumerian in conjunction with ARKit and ARCore to create an augmented reality application that can be published to compatible iOS and Android smartphones.
title: Create an Augmented Reality Application with Amazon Sumerian

abstract: Join us for this builders session where you and a small group work with an AWS subject matter expert to install and configure the AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio.
title: AWS Toolkit for Visual Studio

abstract: While many ETL tools can handle structured data, very few can reliably process unstructured data and documents.
